reviews.text: This cheesecake is awful. The girls at the front door are extremely rude! And should not be in any type of business! I am shocked that their parents raised them that way! <br><br>Other than that, I LOVE THE BARTENDER IMANI!
Rude customer service. Refused to sit my family stating that I would be unhappy bc i had kids and the wait was long. Will not be going back.

Food is always great at any cheesecake but the one at Lenox always has a wait time of at least an hour. It works if you&#39;re still shopping but if you happen to go there too late you&#39;ll be waiting for an hour to two hours. However, once we were seated the service was great. We got our drinks in a pretty timely manner and they were <br><br>The Lemon garlic shrimp dish with angel hair pasta I ordered  was crisp and bursting with all the right flavors. The garnishes worked together beautifully and complimented the light lemony flavor. By the end of the meal we were planning our next visit but definitely accounting for the wait time, especially with a large party size
Great food and awesome service. HUGE menu with lots of variety. Something for everyone. Flat bread pizza exceeded my expectations. Celebration cheesecake is a must!

Omg this is the most horrible experience I ever had.  Since the wait time was an hour for two people.  We decided to just do a pick up.  Yes we called before arriving.  I would&#39;ve gave them NO STARS but ONE was the lowest I could give.  <br><br>We did the online pick up and placed the order at 7:26 PM to be picked up at 8:15 PM.   When we arrived there is no where to stand at 8:10 PM.  You don&#39;t know if your in pick up or waiting to be seated.  There needs to be a certain area for pick up and another for people waiting to be seated.  <br><br>The order wasn&#39;t ready until 8:25 PM.  The young lady who helped us was very polite and nice.  I checked the order and there were NO fries in the order.  So she had to go get me some.  Guess what??  When I opened the light fry container they were NOT only cold but half way fill.  Smh.  <br><br>I told the lady at the pick up counter and requested a manager.  After waiting another 10 minutes, the manager just came apologize and gave me new fries.  <br><br>When I got to the room, omg!!  The cheeseburger spring rolls were so greasy and cold.  <br><br>The burger had sauce when my order clearly said NO SAUCE.  This was the nastiest burger I ever had.  I couldn&#39;t eat it with the warm fries.  <br><br>The Chicken Alfredo was so greasy.  <br><br>I would never go to this location again or yet alone order pick up from here.  They don&#39;t care about the food they serve to guest.  I need a FULL refund for wasting my time and money for this food.  Long story short I ended up having to get in my car and driving to get some food.  Which was another $25 bucks.  Should&#39;ve started with that in the first place.

If you&#39;ve been to one, I feel like you&#39;ve seen them all. Expansive menu and large portion sizes. I particularly enjoyed the waitstaff here though. They were very friendly and kept it lighthearted when I was asking about all the gluten free options while buttering up the dinner rolls. As always I enjoyed the outdoor seating, and didn&#39;t feel like we were just tossed out on the sidewalk, there was a fence/plants barrier with the street and comfortable seating.

Not sure why this only has 3 stars, I go here at least once when I&#39;m in Atlanta every couple years and it has always been so stellar! Service, food. Just wow. I ordered the chicken enchiladas and let me tell you that was seriously the best I&#39;ve very had and I go to a lot of Mexican food restaurants. Cilantro rice was really good, and I never eat the rice that comes with enchiladas, but I did this time. <br><br>So let&#39;s just get right to it, the pecan chocolate turtle cheese cake with whipped cream and ice cream was beyond words. I savored every beautiful bite! <br><br>This is a must go to when here, good luck on parking but once you get past that enjoy the food, just enjoy!!

I have eaten in Cheesecake Factories all over the country. This, by far, is the worse. Food was not bad but the service was terrible.<br><br>The wait on food was extremely long and while we were waiting there was never a time when the waitress would check by to give us updates. We had to ask for everything we needed. We were never asked if we needed anything.<br><br>Coffee had grounds in it. Sent for another cup, still grounds in it.<br><br>The waitress didn&#39;t take plates away as we were done. This is called pre-bussing the table which is common practice.  <br><br>Ordered cheesecake 10 minutes ago. Still waiting..... Probably won&#39;t be back to this one.

Decided to stop in after my meeting. It&#39;s always a wonderful experience. The hostess greeted me with a smile. I decided to sit at the bar and the bartender was very pleasant and provided stellar service. <br><br>For Today&#39;s Lunch treat I ordered: Classic Lasagna- Layers of Fresh Spinach Pasta, Mozzarella, Fontina and Parmesan Cheese. Covered with Our Housemade Tomato-Mushroom and Marinara Sauces. And, a GUAVA DAIQUIRI- Bacardi Lime, Guava, Pineapple and Fresh Lime. Great choices. Great flavors. Very filling.

Thank you Dan who answered the phone and Micheal who made sure our food was ready to be cashed out and paid for with everything going on with COViD, you guys are rockin the take out line and making sure your customers can still access you! This location at Lennox mall is definitely needed! I been going to Cheesecake Factory since I was a child and some things never change! Amazing service THANK YOU!

Poor food quality!!!<br><br>I ordered the flatbread, and it over burned at first time, and this photo is the second one after I ask to change. And the Chicken mango avocado salad is horrible! The mango in it tasted so fishy. After change it, even no avocado in it. And the mango is still fishy! I can&#39;t understand how they make food here! Plus, the water has no lemon in it. Service is so so. So disappointed. Can&#39;t take this at all!<br><br>I am a big fun of Cheesecake Factory in Philadelphia, but here, I will never come back again!<br>Definitely not recommend!

Was visiting my Mom in Atlanta last weekend and we decided to do brunch. I  Didn&#39;t even know that the cheesecake factory served brunch. I was a little skeptical as that&#39;s not their specialty. <br><br>Parking: Lot across from main entrance. <br><br>Service; Our server was pretty good.<br><br>Food: My Mom and I ordered  turkey hamburger meat Patty because they do not offer turkey breakfast meat, with pancakes and eggs over easy very simple. The meat was good.  The pancakes were fine and fluffy.   I believe it was the syrup had a weird taste. My tastebuds did not like it so I didn&#39;t finish them.  My mom enjoys the pancakes here. <br><br>Overall the meal was ok but I don&#39;t think I would be back for brunch.

Poor servís and black girl at the front desk was not trying to work today!!  Wait outside in the freezing weather and there was tables clearly available.. don&#39;t blame Covid.. for you just trying to my lazy

Wasn&#39;t impressed with the food.  The food quality at the location in NY at the palisades mall was much better.  The bartenders were excellent though.  2 nice male bartenders who knew how to make a great margarita.  The receipt said 1 of the names - Aaron.  They had newer menu items then NY.

Excluding cheesecake, I have come to a harsh conclusion that The Cheesecake Factory  is no more than a glorified diner. The food is just not that great. It&#39;s ehhh at best. Over several years I&#39;ve been there several times and I have yet to figure out why I keep going. The food is so basic and drab.

Had a party of 6 on a Sunday for brunch.  Fortunately was seated right away, we just beat the crowd apparently.  Parking however, is horrible, and I was not interested in the $12 valet for the mall just to have lunch.  I had to drive around at least 10 minutes to find a spot and then walk a long way to get there.  <br><br>Server was friendly and attentive.  Everyone thought their food was good, not outstanding.  They do serve coke zero.

Can only speak for delivery cheesecake but wow, this is the dessert I love and remember. <br><br>We&#39;ve order from here twice. The first time I got the 30th Anniversary cake (couldn&#39;t find Chris&#39; Outrageous Cake) and tonight I had the Hazelnut Crunch. My guy had the Cinnabon Cake. Two scoops of ice cream for an additional $1.95 each. <br><br>After tax, delivery fees and a small promo code, we paid about $30 (before tip)<br><br>The Cinnabon is so decadent and appears to have a layer of full on cinnamon roll. The hazelnut had some thicker layers that are difficult to eat with a plastic spoon, but so good. <br><br>Overall, $30 for dessert is yikes for just dessert but well worth it every time. When you want something especially decadent, it&#39;s the way to go. Also, open super late for delivery!

My girlfriend and me came to this Cheesecake Factory the other night to celebrate her birthday. We went in and ask the hostess if there was a wait and she said,&#34;15 minutes&#34; and that&#39;s not too bad even though the restaurant didn&#39;t seem too busy. We wait the 15 minutes but when we were being seated, I noticed that there were a bunch of out tables and we could of been seated right away. I don&#39;t like waiting when there is open tables and not too busy. Besides the seating we really enjoyed our experience. Our waitress was super friendly and had a few laughs with us, we have some changes to the menu and she made sure it came out just right. Additionally, we did come in two hours before the restaurant was closing and we just expected better service.

This is the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been too. <br>I felt rushed sense the moment I walked through the door, when I ordered a birthday cake online they ran back there sealed it so good I couldn&#39;t check it until I got home. <br>When I got home it was the wrong cake. <br>So not only did I over pay for a cake it was wrong. <br>I called they told me to drive back to them when I&#39;m 30min away THEN hung up on me. <br>I called back and told them again the situation a different male manager said he couldn&#39;t do anything for me unless I drove all the way back. That&#39;s bullshit. <br>Terrible terrible customer service. And so unbelievably unprofessional. Thank you so much for wasting both of our time when it takes two seconds to check to make sure the cake is correct.<br>You have one job and you failed.<br><br>Update** I went to return the cake and the Bakery Manager was way nicer and more professional then any of male managers I talked to on the phone. <br>I realize this sounds sexist but it&#39;s the only way I can describe who I was talking about lol. <br>She needs a raise.

I have never received great service at this location. <br><br>I went to cheesecake factory a couple of weeks ago with some friends and had a bad experience. Our waiter was not attentive, very curt, and overall provided very poor service. I excused the behavior because perhaps he was having a bad day. <br><br>However, I went to Cheesecake Factory again last night and had poor customer service from the minute we walked in the door. My group was not properly greeted when we went to the hostess stand. Once we requested a table for three, she told us that she would call our name when a table was ready; which was really weird to us since they were not busy and we could see multiple tables available. But, we just assumed those sections might have been closed off. We walked away for less than 45 seconds before we were called and escorted to a table... a table we saw was available the entire time. But again, it could have been an honest mistake. <br><br>Once we were seated, we waited almost ten minutes before our waiter finally came over. Again, we thought nothing of it. After we received our drink orders, we placed our entree orders. Before the server walked away, I asked him for the house salad to come out as an appetizer. He said that he would put that order in, but I never received a salad last night. Perhaps he forgot, sure. That&#39;s still okay.<br><br>What really irritated me was when we finished our meal. I asked for a to-go box and our waiter picked up my plate as well as my friend&#39;s who did not want his food to-go. I was scared that perhaps he did not hear me so I kindly reminded him that I wanted my food to go. Our waiter snarky replied, &#34;I know. I heard you. I&#39;m going to box it for you.&#34; His reply even shocked my friends who were in disbelief when he walked away. Perhaps it is common that the waiters box your to-go food for you at Cheesecake Factory, but I wouldn&#39;t know after my last experience where I personally had to box my food. <br><br>After two bad experiences in a row, I&#39;m not returning to the Lenox Cheesecake Factory anytime soon. The food is good, but it is clear that staff needs to be retrained on customer service. I understand that people have their off days especially since I used to work in customer service, but there&#39;s no need for snide comments and lack of service. <br><br>Very, very disappointed.

I came into Cheesecake Factory to take a shopping break and catch up with a friend. The menu is massive and we couldn&#39;t agree on what to eat. The restaurant was pretty full, but we were seated in that heated patio pretty quickly (under 10 mins). Our server was attentive and the food was good for the most part. The calamari was pretty bland. This location is pretty big and whenever I come, I enjoy the atmosphere. The happy special is a big draw for people. I would definitely visit again.

This review is for a to go order.<br><br>I placed my to go order approx 2 hours before pickup time.<br>When I arrived for pickup , I saw the curbside parking spaces. When you place a to go order, you can either pick up inside or wait in one of these spaces and someone will bring your food out to you. This location is attached to a very popular and busy mall so it&#39;s almost impossible to find a parking space on a Friday night so I was pleasantly surprised to see those spaces.<br>HOWEVER, all of them were full. But since it was a to go spot, I figured I would wait just a few minutes and some one would leave. WRONG!<br>It seemed as though people were just parking in the spaces to dine in. I called the restaurant to ask if they were doing curbside to go, the lady that answered said &#34;I&#39;m not sure, let me check, hold please&#34;. <br>That hold felt like eternity and probably would have been, had I not finally found a different parking space and walked inside. I was on hold for 23 minutes! Even when I went inside to pick up my order, I was STILL on hold !! <br><br>I immediately asked to speak to a manager, I told him the situation and showed him that I was STILL on hold with his team. He proceeded to tel me that he was sorry and that it&#39;s because the cashiers are the ones answering he phones and they get pretty busy on a Friday night. <br>I&#39;m not in retail management but based off that response I think the most obvious solution would be to not have your cashiers answering the phones on a Friday night. <br>I would have much rather the cashier say, &#34;it&#39;s super busy and we are unable to do any curbside orders, please come inside to retrieve your to go order&#34; simple.<br><br>I finally received my order to go. At least , my order was correct and delicious.

This Place is amazing cannot ever go wrong going to cheese cake factory. Super casual place sort of fancy but a place going. I go at least once a month and it does not disappoint.<br><br>The food is amazing for vegetarians they have awesome combinations and the best lettuce wraps ever. My favorite part is also the they give hot bread in the beginning with butter and ask for some crush pepper you cannot go wrong. The portion Size is huge so embrace your self because your plate won&#39;t be left small. <br><br>Pricing It is expensive off course because it is a nice restaurant but a beautiful place to bring your girl friend or the family or the  kids to enjoy a lavish dinner with drinks and all kinds of dessert. They avocado egg rolls for vegetarians are amazing, the flat bread pizza is amazing. The pasta they will make to your choice with veggies or whatever sauce you want. The meats are really amazing to the people say so I would defiantly check this place out. I love the Lenox feeling of the mall and the restaurant there, you can shop and than come enjoy a fire dinner. The drink selection is endless so is the menu and so are the desserts so please go and enjoy and have a great time. They give warm bread and butter free so take advantage <br><br>Environment wise it&#39;s a beautiful place to come. The lighting is good, and plenty of room. Service is super fast and they bring out food quickly so you don&#39;t have to wait. <br> <br><br>There is plenty of parking for everyone. It might be a little busy with a wait but it&#39;s totally worth it. I say shop and put your name down and you&#39;ll totally be ok.

Who doesn&#39;t love Cheesecake Factory ? The service is always great and the food is consistently great . Even if you order the same thing when a different chef is making it, it will look and taste the same . Their training is great . I love consistency in major chain restaurants . My favorite is the Louisiana Chicken Pasta . Do yourself a flavor !

Not a very good experience for this particular visit. Came here for a family dinner and was left disappointed in many aspects. When first seated, the server prefaced by saying that they didn&#39;t have any ice for any of our beverages. Upon ordering our appetizers and main course, telling the server to put in everything together, we received all our food to be cold. I ordered the Dynamite Shrimp as an appetizer and the Chicken Alfredo as my main course. The Shrimp was very oily in addition to a faint smell of being stale. The chicken Alfredo was cold, and super bland. This combination is my usual order at any Cheesecake Factory so I know how it tastes when done right. The staff was distant, inattentive, and not helpful at all.<br><br>If you can avoid this location, I would highly recommend not coming to this location. Overpriced, under staffed, and honestly overrated.

I have been to this location in the past, but the last time I visited was easily more than five years ago. So last week I stopped in to dine alone after shopping, and was pleasantly surprised to find that they have added the impossible burger along with two more dishes that have impossible meat in them to the menu. I ended up selecting the impossible bolognese sauce with spaghetti which was some of the most delicious pasta I have eaten in a long time. Of course the bread was amazing, you can never go wrong with that. My waiter was very friendly and I have to thank the host at the front for recommending the pasta, because he was on point with that one! Thank you so much for adding more vegetarian/vegan options to the menu! I&#39;m definitely looking forward to coming back, and I hope the rest of your locations follow suit with this new menu.

Service leaves a lot to be desired, especially when you order to-go - doesn&#39;t matter if there are many patrons or not. My sole cheesecake trips are more worth it - but even then, sometimes you get the impression you&#39;d be better off eating at the food court.

I am a frequent visitor of this restaurant, however since COVID the quality of the food has gone down drastically. The service by the waiters is consistently good but each time we visit their is an issue with the food being prepared improperly. Steaks that are supposed to be cooked medium well are charred and tough, Chicken from the Chicken Madeira is rubbery and tough. Food proportions are much smaller than what they use to be and the overall quality and taste of the food has declined. While the managers on duty are quick to apologize and offer a discount or slice of cheesecake for the inconvenience- I would much rather pay full price to have an enjoyable meal that is actually prepared correctly and tastes good. I only gave 2 stars because the waiters and hostess are always polite.
Amazing , I always only prefer this one when I&#39;m going out of town best service best food everything overall  I always love coming here

Best place to come for cheesecake. They have different sizes and approximately 25 different flavors. In the picture I got this for my friends birthday. It&#39;s the Oreo cheesecake. She loved it. I reserved it called ahead to make sure they had it in the size I didn&#39;t need any surprises the day of
We went back for a friend&#39;s celebration and received much better service during dinner time (7pm) on a Wednesday with a different server.

Food was good, but I&#39;m giving three starts because of the slow service. I&#39;ve noticed this trend the past few times I&#39;ve come. The restaurant needs more waitstaff or kitchen workers or something. We were sat for 25 minutes before we got our drinks. We ordered an appetizer, two entrees, and dessert. The table beside us (4 people) had been sitting there before we got sat, and we finished our dessert before they ever got their food. Don&#39;t eat here unless you want to sit for 2 hours. We came at 3pm on a Saturday, but it apparently wasn&#39;t early enough to beat the dinner rush as we had a 20 minute wait to be sat. The server seemed stressed but got us everything we needed.

I came to have lunch and the chicken my wife ordered was raw... really then waitress told me ohhh that&#39;s because the marinade it looks raw but it is not....then I showed the picture she came back with the manager.

Was here on Sunday APRIL 28, 2019. Myself and two other coworkers stopped in to eat after a busy day. To have something good before we left back to Chicago the next day. <br><br>1- service was terrible. Our waiter was so terrible he stop coming to our table. Never checked on us and then another waiter started to serve us and wasn&#39;t told he was our new waiter.  <br><br>2 the food was terrible. One of my coworkers got food poisoning later that night and had to go to the doctor from the airport. He had the avocado egg Rolland some pasta. My food wasn&#39;t good at all I had the chicken sandwich and spicy salad  <br><br>Then we call to speak to the manager and he was so rude. So I will never support this company ever again.

I had to speak with five different staff members to pickup my cheesecake. The curbside pickup order was not ready at the designated time. And on top of it 2 waiters blatantly lied to me about curbside pickup. Save your money and go somewhere else!<br><br>Detailed Experience:  I ordered curbside pickup on the cheesecake app and paid in advance. I drove to the store, and I had to call twice before someone answered the phone for my order. The person said they don&#39;t do curbside pickup for my food, even though I ordered curbside. I had to get out my vehicle walk in the rain even though I drove my car to the curbside pickup space. I went into the restaurant patio to pickup my food and no one was at the podium for food pickup. I went into the restaurant sitting area and I was directed back to the patio for pickup. I notified the staff there was no one on the patio. Then they called someone to do my pickup and before he gives me my food he leaves. I ask another worker to hand me my food on the table and she gets snappy with me. As she barely looking for my food another server appears from the kitchen with my curbside bag. Too make matters worse the restaurant server with the snappy attitude was the one delivering curbside orders. I&#39;m literally walking behind the same person as she delivers a curbside pickup to the car beside me that arrived after me. And to make matters worse she ( snappy server) lies to me and says oh my car information wasn&#39;t on the receipt because I ordered in the restaurant. Clearly, a blatant lie I ordered on the app and there is a GIANT red curbside sticker on the bag.  So my order was not ready for pickup even though I arrived at the designated time and called twice in advance. I paid for my food and customer service. My entire experience with the restaurant was awful. I would not recommend this place.

Beware, Horrible management!  I will give this place a 0 if it would count.  Enter the Cheesecake Factory at Lenox mall at your own risk! I had a living nightmare customer service experience. <br><br>The manager Ryan Clark falsely imprisoned me, He screamed at employees and patrons to call the police. Falsely accusing me of a charge to have me arrested and criminally trespassed.  This manager is sinister as he attempted to create a crime scene! Why? All due to my first amendment right to freedom of speech- and give a complaint!?. He will not publicly accommodate female working professionals.<br><br>I was traveling alone in town on business- Arriving at the Cheesecake Factory Lenox Mall location approximately 6:30 PM for dinner. After waiting 1 hour for an order, I shared a complaint with manager Ryan Clark. At this point he became aggravated and unreasonable. I became increasingly uncomfortable. At this point I ask for my bill for an appetizer he refused to comp, so I could leave the restaurant. Ryan did not return with bill. After speaking with my server about requested bill she reports being unable to speak with Ryan &#34;about my bill&#34; without retaliation. I approached Ryan in the restaurant and requested my bill once again to leave a hostile and toxic environment and he screamed aloud to patrons and employees, to call the police! For reasons unknown to myself and everyone present this manager attempts to have me falsely charged.<br> I approached the hostess who seated me asking for general management or speak with someone in corporate. Ryan follows and screams at the hostess &#34;don&#39;t talk to her, don&#39;t give her any information, don&#39;t help her.&#34; They refused to provide me with general management name and contact information.<br><br>The Police arrived as I stood awaiting for a response from someone. Surprisingly, I was approached by Ashley Blewett- Head Chef of Grand Lux Café. She informed me that my server had in fact notified her of Ryan&#39;s offensive actions and she was asked to come speak with me. Ashley insisted Ryan&#39;s actions to call the police was all wrong! and the cops should have never been called. I never even had a Meal! Ashley de-escalated this guy and sought to find a solution for me to leave the restaurant. Finally, Ashley received my appetizer bill from manager Ryan Clark. However, this did not stop officers from harassing me in attempts to arrest and criminally trespass me at Ryan Clarks request.  Ashley stepped in again to stop officer&#39;s harassment, arrest, and criminal trespass from the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>Responding Officer then reprimanded Ashley Blewett for her effort to de-escalate and to deter their collective efforts to further detain, criminally arrest &amp; Trespass (or do who knows what else)  because Manager Ryan Clark was in Fact the manager on Duty.  <br><br>I was not released to leave the restaurant until 8:10 pm with No Meal! <br>Ryan Clark is using his authority to abuse, belittle, intimidate, and humiliate cheesecake factory employees and patrons. He is a liability to the Cheesecake Factory and is unreasonable in his actions. This manager on duty creates and maintains a hostile and toxic environment for patrons and employees. Obviously, I was caught in the crossfire of complete restaurant chaos. Upon return to my hotel I called 911 to report manager Ryan Clark falsely imprisoning me. <br><br>Atlanta Police department- Zone two precinct- Evening Supervisor- Sergeant Frazier responded to my grievance &amp; complaint. He contacted manager Ryan Clark to request and obtain Cheesecake Factory General Manger (GM) name and contact information. It was discovered general management Melles Amedie was away on vacation for the week. Sergeant Frazier states that manager Ryan Clark is incompetent in customer service and should lose his position at the Cheesecake Factory. He goes on to state &#34;My officers should have never been called into the restaurant to arrest or criminally trespass you.&#34; <br><br>In addition, I spoke with Lieutenant Grigsby and he did some further research on Cheesecake factory corporate office contacts and insist I follow up with complaints to corporate office.

I am a  their table brown bread, but please don&#39;t be fooled... this is not whole wheat bread. I come here couple of times a month for lunch. Food is &#34;okay&#34;, but this place is more about coming to have fun with friends &amp; chat after your mall activities, and having cheesecake/ desserts... or if it&#39;s conveniently located to you.

One of the worst birthday meals ever! Ate at the Lenox location last week and not sure if I&#39;ll return. Our server Kevin was the absolute worst and his manager Sarah R. was no better! From feeling discriminated against to waiting 45 minutes to receive our food AND drink refills, to having everyone around us complain about the same terrible service, to the lack of apologies and the awkward moments where we received our checks and to-go boxes before barely finishing up our food. Note that Sarah barely did anything and handled this situation poorly!!! Best part, WHO goes to the Cheesecake Factory and leaves without CHEESECAKE?? That would be us because Kevin brought out our checks without even asking if we wanted dessert, indicating that he wanted us out. I think it&#39;s safe to say that both Kevin and Sarah desperately need coaching! <br><br>NEVER HAVE I EVER not left anyone a tip! NEVER! But the service here was so bad that it was warranted!

Went here yesterday for brunch. I thought I&#39;ve been here before but never left a review so here it is. The menu is overwhelming with lots of pages. We settled on getting the following:<br>For appetizer, we had the Crab and artichoke dip with chips instead of the bread it comes with. This item was a hit. I could&#39;ve eaten more of this for sure. Two orders of this would be perfect lol. <br>For main entree, I had the Breakfast tacos and he had the breakfast burrito. We both enjoyed our meals. Would definitely know what to get if we were to come back. I wouldn&#39;t mind ordering the artichoke dip to go for lunch every now and then since I don&#39;t work too far from there.<br><br>The service was average. The place was super busy. It does take the waitress a minute to get back to us. Hence the 4 stars.<br><br>Update: I&#39;ve since had the shrimp scampi and that too is good. This place is consistently good.

Awww, the famous Cheesecake Factory, great atmosphere, friendly staff service with a smile. I had to try the cheeseburger spring rolls for an appetizer... who knew? tasted really good, I wasn&#39;t crazy about the sauce served with it. For my main dish I had the Chicken and Steak Diana what a surprise it was really delicious, I highly recommend it, sorry I took no picture because when it was brought to the table all I wanted to do was dive in. Didn&#39;t have room for dessert however did a carry out of a slice of Red Velvet Cheesecake and a slice of 30th Year Anniversary Cheesecake... can&#39;t wait to taste.

My girl and I finally had a moment to sit down and enjoy a nice evening but the service was trash. Absolutely trash. Our server couldn&#39;t have been more angry. Why was he mad at us? We didn&#39;t do anything to him lol! I thought he was going to throw our food on the table! Real bad energy.

The Cheesecake Factory is always such a classic for me! I came here recently with my boyfriend and I ordered the truffle honey chicken while he got the chicken parm. Both of the meals were delicious and had plenty to take home. The new cherry chocolate cheesecake was also amazing and it might become my new favorite one!

Unfortunately after several attempts to contact the corporate office I was unsuccessful in getting my concerns addressed.  I spoke with Beatrice Brow and have left several messages, with NO RESPONSE. Spoke with Angela Carpenter with Risk Management and left several messages, with NO RESPONSE.  Well now, Cheesecake Factory, you win.  My time is valuable and I will not give anymore time to this issue.  However, I will never patronize your establishment again.  Now I see why the staff and management treat patrons the way they do:  NO ACCOUNTABILITY.

I will give this a complete 5/5. To those who have never tried Cheesecake Factory don&#39;t let the comments scare you away. I decided to order the stuffed mushrooms and fried calamari. It was super delicious and filling. I got the strawberry margarita and it was very good as well. If you&#39;re new to Atlanta I would suggest you try this location out. The service was great, me and my party was able to get also immediately, and the food was good. You can&#39;t leave Cheesecake Factory without getting one of their signature Cheesecakes. Give this a try and you won&#39;t be disappointed!

I ordered the shrimp scampi from door dash and it was cold and gross. The shrimp was fried which was strange. Breading was soggy. The sauce tasted sour and it was unbearable. Usually when I dine in the food is good though, specifically the shepherds pie and the herb crusted salmon. Always a long wait time.

hello,<br>this had to be the worst experience i&#39;ve had at a cheesecake factory since covid started. the manager micheal and the front desk staff on this thursday afternoon were distasteful. i understand we&#39;re in a rough time with covid and trying to adjust with this hard times but the service was horrible from the moment i got on the waitlist. after getting put on the waitlist i was told to wait outside, which i did. i found a place just like others underneath the heat lamps outside. everyone was spread out and social distanced. the lady that put me on the waitlist came and told me i couldn&#39;t sit outside. i told her i would like to stay here since there&#39;s heat and i have 2 small children that i can&#39;t walk around in the mall. she then walked away, moments later i feel the heat turn off. when i tried to get back in the door that i came through it was then locked, i had to knock on the door a few times for another customer to help me through the door. multiple people had went back and forth through the same door prior to the lady coming to tell me to move. when i was able to get back through the door i asked to speak to the manager and asked if he authorized the lamps being turned off and he said yes. not one time did he come out and speak to anyone outside before turning the lamps off. when asked about it he proceeded with this superior like attitude. his staff then joined in with this attitude speaking very loudly saying they shouldn&#39;t seat me. after i complained the manger waited until the very last second to seat me even with multiple tables visibly open. the server i had once seated was amazing, apologizing for what he seen take place. even with his great service it was still disappointing to have such a horrible experience during the holiday season, especially for a day that wasn&#39;t very busy at all.

It&#39;s a tradition that my co-workers and I come here for our annual Christmas party and besides coming with my co-workers one time a year, I can say I rarely venture to Cheesecake Factory.  It was super busy at the mall (when isn&#39;t it?) so finding parking was an issue but my superpower patience kicked in and finally found a spot on the other side of Switzerland.  Anyway, I got there about 10 mins after they open and was able to put our name on the list but of course we couldn&#39;t be seated until half of our party showed.  The hostess was kind and checked in with me periodically as to whether or not my party showed and we were seated as soon as everyone arrived.  <br><br>The restaurant is huge and has both indoor and outdoor seating as well as a take out area andddd the amazing display glass of cheesecakes.  I do wish they would make the waiting area bigger because that place gets packed and when there&#39;s a line, it&#39;s just super congested and you don&#39;t know who&#39;s waiting or who&#39;s in line to be put on the waitlist.  We were seated in the back of the restaurant but for a group of our size, they put us at the smallest table.  There were any other tables we could move to so we bunched up and made it work.<br><br>Our waitress Jade was sweet and I loved how she interacted with the group.  She was attentive, apologized for delays, and I could tell she was a people person and handled our group with ease and threw in jokes here and there so that made our visit enjoyable.  The menus are huge and have sooooi many items to pick from (they do need to be cleaned because most of them were quite sticky) but I kept is simple and ordered the pasta carbonara which came with green peas, bacon, a garlic Parmesan cream sauce, and I added chicken.  It arrived hot and smelled reallllly good.  The sauce wasn&#39;t overwhelming and the bacon was divine.  I also ordered a red sangria (kudos to the bartender) and the white chocolate cheesecake to take home (ohhhh it&#39;s in the fridge and will be noshed upon at the perfect time).<br><br>Overall a great experience and if Jade&#39;s manager sees this.  Give. That. Lady. A. Raise.

The Lenox Cheesecake Factory is by far the worst location in the region. I have been to the Dunwoody location and always have great service. The front desk staff is terrible. We walked in, no eye contact or greeting. We get seated and notice the table is dirty-- a chunk of a loaf of bread on the floor dirty. We ask if its possible for them to just sweep it. The hostess mumbled and walked away. We assumed she was asking someone to come back and clean it but after standing in the middle of the aisle for 5 min, we realized no one was coming back. I walked back to the front to ask again or to give us a new table, I was told, &#34;well we don&#39;t sweep, I told the bus staff&#34;. I was then told a new table would be a 15 minute wait. <br><br>At that point, I walked out. I am done with this location. Multiple worsening experiences each time. Rude service, dirty facility. Just drive 10 more minutes to the Dunwoody spot.

I love dining at Cheesecake . My favorite dish to have there is the turkey burger. This time they didn&#39;t have turkey . I went with the salmon, broccoli and mashed potatoes. The salmon was dry, the broccoli was ok and the potatoes were half cooked. I had a little crunchy mashed. My sweet tea taste more like slightly sweetened water. That&#39;s ok, because I&#39;m watching my sugar intake. Needless to say I didn&#39;t finish my meal. Im not a big eater. My portions sizes are small . I ate some and threw out the rest . <br><br>Normally I start with what it&#39;s like once I enter the restaurant, but I decided to work my way backwards. Let me say, I usually go out in the weekdays in general, when things are more calm . Each time I&#39;ve eaten at the Lenox Mall location it has been a pleasant experience. This time I went in a Saturday. Oh child that was a big mistake. Huge mistake! It was so chaotic, I thought it was Mother&#39;s Day. The line to be seated formed from the front counter to the sidewalk. It was actually 2 lines as you&#39;ll see in my picture. One line is to check in and get a ticket , where they text you when a seat is available. Once you get the ticket, you step over into the second line to wait for a text. That line blocked the bakery counter with the desserts. I watched the check in guy as he grew more and more confused. He lost tickets and there were people getting seated that came in after the Mister and I. Finally we had to speak up, and young lady tried to look for our ticket that we gave the guy at the counter, but it was lost. Finally she proceeded to take us to be seated despite of.  This location doesn&#39;t have a solution for managing large crowds of people. <br><br>Our waiter was nice , but noticeably no one had time for small talk. The staff worked hard and they looked very focused driven. I won&#39;t eat here on the weekends anymore.
A friend &amp; I went here to grab a bite. The ambience is nice but the lights are dimly lit. Nice setting to sit &amp; have low conversation with a friend.

I&#39;ll start this review by saying most Cheesecake Factory restaurants are the same to me. This particular location, however, was not up to par. I visited on a Saturday night around 8pm and the line was out the door to even put your name on the list. Luckily, my friend and I snagged a bar seat and was able to order right away. <br><br>We ordered drinks and pasta, then asked for bread, only to find out they were totally out of bread. In all seriousness, everyone knows the bread is a staple at the Cheesecake Factory, so that&#39;s something that should&#39;ve been communicated before putting in our order full of pasta. The bartender insisted that there was no bread at any location that day which I find hard to believe, but we said okay because we were starving. <br><br>We got our food, which came out fine, but once we stopped eating for a moment to chat, we had a servers come around and try to literally take our plates with food 2 separate times! They didn&#39;t ask if we were done just tried to grabbed them from behind us. It was ridiculous! Then the bartender tried to take my friends food again after I asked for a box for mine and she didn&#39;t. The people at the bar next to us even commented on the fact that they kept trying to take our plates. I&#39;m not sure what the rush was, but I&#39;m 100% sure that wasn&#39;t taught to them in training.

The Cheesecake Factory at Lenox in ATL is probably one of the worst locations I&#39;ve ever dealt with for &#34;To Go&#34; or &#34;Curbside&#34;. I&#39;m certain we are not the only ones that have dealt with the lack of responsiveness on the phones when one calls and it just rings and when an employee does pickup they act as if they are being inconvenienced. If they are not going to provide the level of service they advertise with to go and/or curbside they should discontinue the option(s). The consumer ends up paying a lot of money for cold food and has to go home frustrated with lack of customer service. At that point who can enjoy a meal when there&#39;s extreme frustration? Since this has been several times we are at a point where we&#39;re trying to decide whether or not we will patronize the establishment any more.

Me and my friends went before a concert on Saturday evening. There was a 45 minute wait and we were pressed for time. However, there are small tables at the bar so it was perfect when a party of three left and we were able to sit at that table.  I only wanted something small so I saw the cauliflower bites and the crab bites. Both were delicious but those cauliflower bites were crispy, sweet taste and worth every bite. They almost tasted like general tso chicken. <br>Our waitress had a slight attitude but we didn&#39;t take it personal because it was a Saturday evening and I&#39;m sure she was extremely busy. <br>Overall I can&#39;t wait to go back to get those cauliflower bites.

Please do not come here on the weekends if you dislike crowds and waiting.  It is always VERY busy at this location. <br><br>If you are lucky you will get a seat at the bar. The bartenders are very moody, but the food is consistently prepared well and the drinks are strong and well mixed. <br><br>Parking is free. The restrooms are always a disaster. I try to avoid on weekends and holidays. <br><br>It&#39;s not a romantic date spot, more of a sports bar<br>atmosphere. I come for the food and it&#39;s good.

Cheesecake factory always hits the spot because there is always something to find for everyone. This location is a little inconsistent in the food quality but service has been great the two time we have gone. I finally ordered the Korean Cauliflower appetizer and OMG what was I waiting for, order this!! Does not matter if you are vegetarian, vegan or love meat, this cauliflower dish is the best I&#39;ve had. And I have tried a lot since I am mostly vegetarian. It is so flavorful, indulgent, fried crispy and the sauce is to die for. I came back just for these the second time, which were not as crispy as the first time but just as tasty. It is on the small plates menu but it is a big portion. The mac and cheese balls are great here, love the avocado rolls too. The Miso Salmon was just ok, it did not taste fresh but the cream sauce made the dish. I&#39;ve had the BBQ salad and it was good but didn&#39;t taste as fresh as other locations. Same with the cheesecake, surprisingly not as fresh tasting. We went during the crazy holiday season and left satisfied overall, thanks to the korean cauliflower, probably the most underestimated dish on the menu!

Food and service is always good here. The crispy chicken costoletta is my all time favorite but love their skinnylicious menu! So many amazing things from the lemon garlic shrimp to the turkey avocado sandwich. <br><br>The skinny cocktail options are great as well! There&#39;s gluten free, vegan, vegetarian, and pescatarian options as well which is amazing for anyone with dietary restrictions.

First of all, this Cheesecake was in Lenox Square which is a BEAUTIFUL mall in Buckhead! My family and I came here on a Wednesday night at 8 pm, and the restaurant was PACKED. The wait to sit outside was a long one, and even though inside was freezing, we really didn&#39;t want to wait any longer because we were starving! <br><br>The service was a bit slow, and I&#39;m assuming because the restaurant was extremely crowded. But all of our dishes were phenomenal. The complimentary bread they gave us came straight out of the oven and melted in my mouth. We ordered Tomato Basil flatbread, Chipotle Chicken (minus the Chicken) Pasta, and 1 other thing that I can&#39;t remember, but all of it was perfect!! Super creamy and delicious! Would definitely recommend!

Has the shepherd lost his cows OR has he gone vegan???? <br><br>SHEPHERD PIE SHOULD BE CALLED MUSHROOM PIE! <br><br>Only 2 bites of ground beef! Served in a plate with a few hard carrots, a few peas and all MUSHROOMS. Awful!<br><br>Service was mediocre at best.

Today I had my BMT celebration at Cheesecake Factory. I ordered two Cosmopolitans, the French Country Salad, the Chicken Marsala, and strawberry cheesecake. The service was a 3 star experience, drinks were 5 stars, the salad was 3 stars, and the Chicken Marsala was 3 stars. I gave the service 3 stars because the the process to return an item was looooong. I gave the drinks 5 stars because they were perfect! I gave the salad 3 stars because there was barely any goat cheese on it. I gave the Marsala 3 stars because it was a &#34;new&#34; or different version and I did not care for it. Usually, in my experience, Cheesecake Factory is consistent from location to location, but not today. Overall the experience was less than what I would have expected and I will not return to this location. The cost of the food 270.00 or  $211.00 before tip, was not worth it.

It&#39;s exactly whatt you would expect from a Cheesecake Factory.   The hostess is on a power trip. The managers are useless.  The servers have an attitude.  The location is what saves this place.  If it wasn&#39;t raining we wouldn&#39;t have eaten there.  I&#39;m not sure what kind of system they have at the hostess station.  I&#39;ve worked in restaUrants aNd I&#39;ve never seen such a sh*tshow.  Never again!  And I wouldn&#39;t if i wEre you either.

12/31/19 The food was delicious Jasmine our hostess was amazing! The place was very crowded on The eve of New Years the only thing Wrong was the to go cheesecake I ordered.  I didn&#39;t check the bag while I was there but it was not what I wanted I really wanted my red velvet cheesecake:(

I ordered the crab bites for the appetizer. They were delicious. The are little round balls of crab meat. The are fried. All crab meat and no breading. I ordered the chicken Madeira with mashed potatoes and asparagus. It was scrumptious. Cooked to perfection. It was plenty to eat. They give you two chicken breast. I could only eat one and a little mashed potatoes. I have plenty for lunch tomorrow. I ordered the red velvet cake for dessert to go. I haven&#39;t eaten it yet. I&#39;m sure it will be delicious. I didn&#39;t give five stars because the food was not hot when it was brought out. I will go back again.

Last night I went on a date to The Cheesecake Factory and it was absolutely amazing. My date made a reservation so we were helped immediately and greeted and sat by a super friendly greeter. Yesterday was her first day and I don&#39;t remember her name, but she was really funny and sweet! Once we were sat, Lorraine was our server and she was absolutely amazing! She was incredibly sweet! If you plan on going to Cheesecake anytime soon, I STRONGLY suggest you ask for her. she was very attentive and was quick on her feet. She kept our drinks filled, kept us smiling and laughing, and was sure to check back after food and drinks were delivered to make sure everything was going well. My date actually surprised me and asked me to be his girlfriend with a plate of my favorite Oreo cheesecake and had the question written on the plate for me. It was really sweet and cute and Lorri was excited for us. It couldn&#39;t have been a better date and surprise. Thank you so much Lorri for making my date so special and for being so sweet. We both look forward to seeing you soon!
I enjoyed the food, the wait was kinda of long , the cheesecake was amazing but I did not capture any pics because I ate it so fast

I brought my daughter to Atlanta to experience the dinner life up here. I was super excited and she was so excited. She even put it on her Snapchat. We were eating our food and as she cuts her broccoli half. It had a big Maggitt in it. I could no longer eat my food because I was so grossed out. I had only eaten a few bites of my food. The manager Ricky comped the meal with the Maggitt in it. But he wouldn&#39;t comp mine. Even though I lost my appetite and could no longer eat. But the waiter Duane was absolutely sweet and amazing.

I love the food and environment at Cheesecake Factory but my family went here two months ago and I&#39;m still thinking about our experience.<br><br>Our waiter was negligent...we asked for bread 3 times and he always said &#34;they&#39;re backed up and making more now&#34;. We&#39;d consistently see other tables getting bread. We finally had to waive over another waiter who then got us bread.<br><br>Additionally, we ordered drinks at the beginning of the meal. Our drinks didn&#39;t arrive until we were done with our appetizer. We saw them sitting at the bar for roughly 20 minutes before our waiter brought them over to us.<br><br>Overall, our experience was based on our waiter and not the food or atmosphere of this place.

The only problem I have with this location is when you go in the evening all the kids and young people are working so they service is always better in the day. Food was delicious as always. I went for dinner so I decided to go around 7:30 because of the traffic headed that way. <br><br>I had the Crusted Chicken Romano and it was perfect. The food took a little too long to come out especially because there was a table next to me with more people who came in after me and they got their food before I did. The fact that the food was great made up for it a little.<br><br>Oh yes and you will be parking at the mall so just beware and put belongings in their rightful places. Remember where you parked your car and try to park in front of Macy&#39;s or the Sprinkles ATM if possible.

My wife and I just love this place. Actually, we haven&#39;t ever been to any Cheesecake Factory and been disappointed. Today, we tried the ribeye steak and Sheila&#39;s chicken salad! Both were awesome! So happy we came here for dinner!

Ok so I rounded this review up to three stars but it really deserved two and a half stars let me tell you why......<br>First off it was a Thursday night around 8:41pm we had just left candytopia and my baby suggested Cheesecake Factory..... we were added to the list and told we would receive a text message once our table was ready in about 45 minutes. I really didn&#39;t want to wait but my baby really wanted it. I went to the restroom and on my way there I spotted SEVERAL unoccupied tables. Well at 9:45 I called the restaurant to see how much longer it was going to take. I was told 5 minutes maximum. As soon as I hung up my phone received the table ready message. <br>Finally we sit at our table unfortunately I don&#39;t remember the waitress name but she was really nice attentive and friendly. <br>I had so much candy at the previous stop and I was so annoyed at the long wait time that I lost my appetite so I went with the buffalo blast an appetizer. Hubby ordered a spaghetti dinner of some sort and the baby ordered the corndogs.<br>My husband dish was excellent (his words) my buffalo blast we not nearly as tasty as I remember and my baby corn dogs looked deformed AF. I did tell my waitress that it was my son birthday. They did not sing to him although somewhere in the far southwest distance I did hear murmurs of staff singing happy birthday to another patron. I have a few ideas in my head as to why my son wasn&#39;t sung to but I won&#39;t go there this time.... but let it happen again !!!!<br>Do better Cheesecake Factory at Lenox DO BETTER or close!!!<br><br>Look at my baby happy face mommy and daddy sung happy birthday to our baby!!!!! He was so positive oblivious to the sucky service. I wanted to show my whole *** but opted to be on my best behavior because this little cute face was watching me <br>I&#39;m going to take a star away I just got pissed off again.....

In a word, this place sucks.  I am sure food is as good as any other Cheesecake Factory but this location is so crowded and hard to park and get to.  Had a group of 12 people for a birthday celebration.  They do not take reservations.  Got there at 2 for a 3 PM late lunch.  Was told to seat all 12 together would be a FOUR HOUR wait.  No thank you.  Was then told for two tables would be an hour and a half which we opted for.  After this time period and no relief in site, we went elsewhere.  nice payday they lost on this day although I am sure it will not put them in the poorhouse any time soon.  Seemed lots of people willing to put up with the nonsense there.  My time and money better spent elsewhere.  <br><br>Save your money and time and frustration and go elsewhere.  If you are dying for Cheesecake Factory and it is good, go to Cumberland.  Crowded, yet but not like this IMO.  Nuts.

Cheesecake Factory- I promise you there is something for everyone here.  A book/menu of a wide range of dishes and desserts.  If you&#39;re gonna to have cheesecake in your business name you better believe this place knows their cheesecakes.  The cheesecake game is very strong at CF!  So yummy.<br><br>This is a really nice Cheesecake Factory location.  This CF is located in Lenox Square Mall.  It&#39;s in the front main entrance area near Starbucks.  I must say I was disappointed when they shut down the original Buckhead CF location a couple of years ago; however, they did this new location nice!  It&#39;s not two stories like the old location but this spot is bright, open, and very spacious.  I dig the layout.  Love the signature yellow tone colors with the cool light fixtures on the high ceiling and the new modern addition of mosaic artwork behind the bar.  That mosaic artwork is so pretty!!  The bathrooms a little far off if you&#39;re sitting at the tables near the bar but it did allow me to see all the cool details of this place.  <br><br>Service was good.  Hostess was friendly, prompt, and helpful.  Our server made sure we had everything we needed and checked up on his throughout our meal.<br><br>The lettuce wraps was a very nice generous portion and had beautiful plating.  We also ordered the Da Vinci pasta, jambalaya pasta, and Madeira chicken.  Everything was pretty cooked well and you know, Cheesecake Factory does NOT play with their portions.  They are very generous in the portions for all their main entrees.  Always enough for you to take some leftovers home.  The Da Vinci pasta didn&#39;t have enough sauce on it but did like how generous the portion was.  The mashed potatoes on the Chicken Madeira is sooooo good!<br><br>We opted out of the desserts this time but their cheesecakes are pretty amazing.  Actually...they are really amazing.  They have a huge variety available as well every time.<br><br>I will definitely be back to this location!  Don&#39;t know why it took me this long to check this &#34;new&#34; location out.  <br><br>They have free parking (mall parking) and also mall valet is available.  They also have a patio too.
This location is in a really busy part of town so plan ahead and be prepared to wait. The food was average and the service was, too.

I usually really like The Cheesecake Factory out of all the chain restaurants. However, the Lenox location is the worst I&#39;ve ever been to. The sizes of salads at Cheesecake Factory locations are double the size than this location. I can finish an entire salad here, whereas at other locations, I have to box some up. Also, last night, a friend and I went to a late dinner at this location... we had to wait 35 minutes for our food!  There was just two of us and we got there after the dinner rush. Our server apologized but did nothing to accommodate us. For one of the more expensive options of a chain restaurant, I expect consistency of the size of the entree as well as a reasonable wait time for my food to arrive. Disappointed indeed.

Food was okay. I had the brick chicken with roasted potatoes and I was very dry and salty. The Egg roll sampler was so almost to greasy to eat. Also the place just wasn&#39;t very clean. I was pretty upset watching them wipe the tables with dirty rags and not cleaning the floors. I don&#39;t expect the to mop or anything but there were fries, napkins and utensils on the floor every time they say someone down.

I have eaten at cheesecake factory several times with my family but this was a terrible experience. We waited about an hour an a half because it was mother&#39;s day, which of course we understand. Once we arrived at our table the floor was completely covered with food. We had to ask for it to be cleaned. Why wasn&#39;t it cleaned before we were escorted. We had bread and chatted while we wiated for our food arrive. My parents had blackened salmon and my sister the parmesan herb chicken and I had the friend chicken. It was past 2pm so I wasn&#39;t able to order the chicken and waffles i originally wanted. <br><br>While everyone else enjoyed their food I did not enjoy mine. The sandwich was bland and had tomatoes even though I specifically asked for no tomatoes. Needless to say I didn&#39;t finish y food and asked for it to be taken back. <br><br>When we received the bill all 4 dishes had been put on the bill including mine. I had to ask for it to be taken off because the meal was not acceptable. They took it off and we paid the rest. To be it wasn&#39;t good enough. We didn&#39;t enjoy the experience. <br><br>We are visiting Atlanta and deserve far better service. I will advise myself if I should ever return here again. <br><br>Very disappointing.

If you&#39;re concerned about social distancing do not order from this location. Though I ordered curbside pick up I was told to come inside to pick up. When I went inside their lobby was crowded with people placing or waiting for orders. Orders were delayed causing longer wait times to stand in crowd. Really defeats the purpose of ordering curbside pick up and social distancing during such a crucial time where this matters.

Stopped by for a delicious late lunch with family! Was a perfect time to enjoy a few Tropical Tiki Punch&#39;s, Pretzel Bites w/ Cheddar Cheese Fondue,Crispy FriedMozzarella &amp; Fontina Cheese with Marinara Sauce, Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes &amp; Pan Seared Branzino white Fish w/lemon! Each bite we took was Delicious, mouth watering goodness, a great time tasting all these Fabulous treats! Service &amp; waitstaff were friendly &amp; courteous! Come relax &amp; enjoy the ambience, food, drinks &amp; conversations with your family &amp; friends real soon! Thanks CheeseCake Factory for another Fabulous dining experience!

We visited the Lenox location today. In years past, I&#39;ve always been a fan of The Cheesecake Factory, but this visit was just plain, bad:(<br><br>The service was the thing that stood out as being the worse part. It was me &amp; my daughters (8 and under). Our check was 120.00, and I STILL left a very generous $25.00 tip, against my better judgement. This is a horribly ran business. <br><br>The staff is not friendly at all, they act irritated to even allow you to walk by. They instruct you to &#34;move here&#34; when you&#39;re waiting on a hostess in a very short, curt manner. They left us sitting FOREVER for EVERYTHING. They also brought food out finally to everyone, and completely left out my 6 year old little girl&#39;s chicken quesadilla. Left all of us sitting there approx 14-16 minutes without her quesadilla. Then the cheesecake order was a hot mess, he brought one piece, 5-7 minutes, 2 more pieces, 12 minutes later the other piece (which was boxed up and taken) There was zero acknowledgement from anyone. All of us were left with empty glasses with no refills. And I still tipped generous just to be the better person. I know most people would tip nothing. <br><br>These servers are making extremely good money, and have no skill set and are borderline rude. The general manager SUCKS @ Lenox. They need a new manager ASAP. It shows this manager needs to go in what is accepted.<br><br>-There are countless staff members wandering around aimlessly with blank looks on their face. <br><br>-I witnessed zero team work. No one stepping in &amp; helping out. They just have zero care. <br><br>-They we&#39;re doing us a favor by wearing uniforms. This is the treatment you receive from this team.<br><br>-They are allowing a middle age man that is a server to wear an &#34;Elvira type wig&#34; that is completely inappropriate hair to be worn by this man serving food. With a gigantic neon pink hair bow. The wig obviously is hard to wear/deal with, so while dealing with patrons he&#39;s digging his entire hand up under the wig and clawing his scalp/head in front of all the patrons. I thought it was a scene from impractical jokers. <br><br>This place is a joke &amp; I donated $25 to a sorry, entitled server. What a waste of an afternoon. I can&#39;t believe this experience actually cost money.

Like I said in my previous review, I adore The Cheesecake Factory and it sucks that I had to leave a poor review due to one person&#39;s misbehavior. Management and corporate both reached out to me to make things right so I will do the same. Our waitress was excellent and the cheesecake was delicious as per usual. The menu has everything even for the pickiest of eaters! They will forever have my business just not this location..

I&#39;ve been here a lot and have had a really good experience every single time. The house bread in the beginning is amazing- both the brown bread and the sourdough bread. I got the Chicken Bellagio which is a pesto pasta with breaded chicken topped with arugula and prosciutto. The portion sizes are massive and the food is delicious. My friends got the veggie burger which was surprisingly very delicious! The Raspberry lemon cheesecake in the end was amazing! Will definitely visit this place again!

I go there often but decided to try carryout today. Never again. My Chinese Chicken Salad has no chicken on it at all. Yet they made me pay 54 cents for an extra cup of dressing. Also, I instructed them to mix the dressing in and there was no dressing on the salad. Ridiculous!

Service was SUPER SLOW. It took 30 mins to get a table. In which time we tried to get a drink at the bar and when they gave us our table the bartender was still making our drinks. We spent $200 between 3 people and you would think they thought we were some broke people the way they were treating us. The traffic to get in and out of here is ridiculous and had i known we would have a disappointing experience after that hold up i would have gone elsewhere. We really just wanted to have a good time and get good food w drinks and chose cheesecake instead of the mexican place behind it. Instead they just had us stressed out and annoyed waiting for stuff the whole time. But 3 stars because the food was right when it finally came out.

I typically don&#39;t come to Cheesecake Factory because their food isn&#39;t that great, but my friend and I decided to stop here while visiting Lennox.<br><br>Our server, Amy, took her time to come to our table and take our drink orders. Then she took about 10-15 minutes to bring us our drinks. Then she took another 10-15 minutes to bring us our bread. After about 30 minutes, Amy had not checked up on us to offer more bread or refill our drinks. It took another server to see my clearly upset face, to refill our drinks.<br><br>Finally, our food comes out and my friend&#39;s cole slaw and my blue cheese was hot. These 2 items are things that definitely do not need to be warm in the slightest.<br><br>We called the manager, Will, over to mention the warm items and our servers lack of presence. He didn&#39;t seem to care about our complaints. He kept coming up with counter arguments to our points instead of just mending the issues. He eventually fixed the problems, but he could&#39;ve done so without the hassle.<br><br>All in all, terrible service, adequate food. Disappointing experience.

This place entirely too busy for the quality of food that I was just served. Currently sitting at the restaurant waiting on my husband to finish his plate... because the first jambalaya dish they sent out was a mess, and we begrudgingly sent it back. The noodles were all dry and clumped together<br><br>Here is my review:<br><br>Pros<br>Menu options, you&#39;re bound to find something that you like on this menu, it&#39;s beyond long... <br><br>Cons<br>Wait time is usually a problem here once seated<br><br>It took over 45 minutes to get two dishes, and when the food came out we har to send the jambalaya back. I am so confused as to why they didnt toss that dish vs. thinking someone would want to eat it. Sigh. <br><br>The new dish also took another 30 minutes<br><br>I ordered the Jamaican pepper chicken and shrimp. Average meal. I&#39;ve ordered this before at another location, and it was better. <br><br>I came here because I got a gift card for Christmas, I will not be coming back<br><br>I didn&#39;t take pictures of the food. My apologies

The food is great..The wait was not so great... The receptionist should have told us there were open tables on the patio.....i ordered the jambalaya pasta and the pineapple moscow mule both tasted great. Our waiter did great.
Just for the cheesecake that&#39;s a calorie atomic bomb. It&#39;s to die for. <br>It is just way too crowded on weekends and the service is inexplicably slow to handle this crowd.
Typical cheese cake culture nice ambiance decent crowd and good food great place to hang out and mingle with the buckhead district folks i highly recommend this location

I went to the bar and place my order, the service was horrible the food was absolutely disgusting and I get the same thing everytime I come here. The steak Diane I order was medium well and taste burnt. I told the manager in the braid and he was no help, he said I have the cut the steak in the middle because the steak is small. One server is singing my milkshake while I&#39;m eating. I didn&#39;t even receive my bread. Will not be coming backing you this location. Bartenders, servers , and manger could use some experience.

I hope this review helps many other people. Yesterday for the holiday(memorial day) we decided for the first time in months to order curbside,Sense right now I don&#39;t particularly trust sanitary practices of restaurants. I stepped out of my comfort zone and ordered online a turkey burger/ fries from cheesecake factory Lenox mall. When my boyfriend and I picked up the order it was our mistake to not check the food at that time. Since the mall area was crowded and because of COVID-19 we simply rushed to the car and took the order home. It was at home to my surprise my turkey burger was covered with old rotten looking Avocado on it. And to add insult to injury my fries looked like someone had eaten half of them or I was simply cheated out of a full order of fries. The fries literally had no lie 6-7 fries in the box. (See pic) We spent over $25 for the meal and our time to go through the hassle of putting on a mask going to a crowded place picking up curbside to end up with a half order and rotten looking avocado(see pic attached). I called the restaurant requesting a manager and was bounced around to several employees pretending to be a manager. There was a manager in the takeout department with Spanish accent helping me but went into a rant about the fries and some lame excuse about the avocado being brown because it was under a heat lamp. We all know how old avocado looks she then told me to bring all the food back for her to examine it etc. I told her no &amp; please let me speak to somebody else that could help me. She left me on hold for 10 minutes I hung up call back and got another manager Then finally got a resolution that ended in mailing me a gift card for the amount I spent. Sadly this restaurant don&#39;t realize that it wasn&#39;t about the money it was about the quality of their food and the disorganized phone skills of random employees pretending to be a manager while still not helping. no amount of money can make up for the service &amp; gross food we received. Unsafe feeling of a few fries in a box not knowing if it was half eaten etc. What a fun way to spend our holiday.  I hope this review can save you &amp; your family some time from ordering curbside at cheesecake factory at Lenox mall it&#39;s a waste of time energy and money.

The food and service here was really good. The average meal is 15 dollars and cheesecake is 8 dollars. It is expensive so I could not give it five stars. I can&#39;t complain about the server, the waiter I had was extraordinary. I would suggest sharing a Cheesecake with someone, because they are huge.

I usually LOVE The Cheesecake Factory, but this location was HORRIBLE! I always order the Asian lettuce wrap tacos. I am not exaggerating when I say the chicken was burnt, no bigger than my little finger and so hard I could have cracked a tooth. They did a great job of burying it in the bottom, so it couldn&#39;t be seen. As if that wasn&#39;t bad enough, I decided to pull the chicken out and put it on the plate to see if the waiter would say anything about it when he removed the plate from the table. Not one word was said to me about the chicken and it was the only thing left on the plate

I am highly disappointed in the service that I received as well as the prank that I discovered last night while dining at this location. We waited an hour for our food to come out. The waitress was so busy flirting with a guy at another table that she was totally unfocused on being attentive to our table or the table beside us. Evidently she didn&#39;t need her tip money. To make matters worse, when our food FINALLY came out, my mother was attempting to sprinkle what she thought was salt into her food, but it was really SALT MIXED with SUGAR. The last time I checked, tampering with food is a possible felony in some states! When I asked the server about it, she did not care and was very non-chalant.  I have NEVER experienced anything like this in my life. I would like to speak to the person at the TOP of the corporate ladder about this incident.
Overall good service but prices of drinks are not shown ($15!!!!) and the food for both me and my friend was subpar.

As a server myself, I&#39;m typically very understanding when I go to other restaurants. But when I arrived at this restaurant and had to wait 20 minutes in line to pick up a to go order, got my food cold and received an attitude from the cashier, I am super disappointed with the service. There is no excuse for the service today and the organization that the staff seems to carry amongst themselves. Let&#39;s just hope my food is good

Came from Houston to visit. The hostess was VERY rude. Barely acknowledged me and looked at me up and down. Then they sat<br>Me In a cramped space in the corner despite it being super early. They need to be trained more on customer service skills.

The food was ok, but the CUSTOMER SERVICE IS AWFUL!!!!!! We had lunch on Sept 5 2019 and was seated I both away from the kitchen. Having an allergy to Tomatoes I expressed repeatedly to the server, who could care less. This location is busy and if your feeling Stress, taking it out on the guest is Not the right option. We have dined at this location each visit to Buckhead, but going forward I&#39;ll select the Perimeter location.

A friend and I just came in wanting to get a slice of cheesecake. We noticed so many people waiting with SO many tables available. We kindly asked at the front desk that we had ordered to go and if we could sit outside. The woman proceeded to say yes and there was no wiat. We asked if we could have our to go to the table and the manager came over, not even looking us in the eyes, saying &#34;well if it&#39;s to go then it&#39;s to go&#34;. He would not let us eat our cheesecake there saying he has too many people waiting. This is ridiculous considering we were told NO WAIT for outside. And we had already PAID and we were denied to change our order to for there and denied to take a seat. He was extremely disrespectful. I do not recommend coming here, save your money and go somewhere local.

I&#39;m finding a hard time remembering the last time I was at a bar and not have the bartender ask me at least ONCE if everything was ok. Mind you, I only had a small lunch and a glass of wine, but can you at least act like you want to provide good service?? And there was a grand total of TWO others at the bar while I was there. By the time I left, it was just me. It makes you wonder what it was really about. And I never pull the race card unless it&#39;s blatant, so I won&#39;t quite go there. But it does make me wonder...
Rude and Poor Customer Service! I&#39;m going to write a review for every time I come in and you suck! Attitudes all around!
I went here today with my dad for the first time for lunch. It was really good. I had the Shepherds pie and also the Pumpkin Cheesecake. It was my first time going to The Cheesecake Factory.
Grabbed. Red velvets cheesecake to-go! It was amazing ! The young lady that took my order was so great and smiled, giving me a warm sense of customer service! Pay them a visit if you&#39;re in town !

I&#39;ve been to cheesecake factories before, this place is known for being packed and hours of wait time which wasn&#39;t different for us on a Sunday night either. We had a 70 minute wait time, still opted for it because of the group we were in, didn&#39;t mind the wait too much. When our wait was over and we got the text, there was another 10-15 min wait to get seated. So after an hour and a half wait as we get seated, there wasn&#39;t a server to our table for another few minutes. Silverware missing, had to grab it ourselves from another table because the wait is too long when we asked for anything. Didn&#39;t get water or menu for a while again. No fresh bread either, it was apparently in the oven forever. <br><br>We ordered Louisiana chicken Pasta and Parmesan Chicken Pasta Pizza. Food arrived another 30 mins later. Although the portion size was great, the food quality was below average. Wasn&#39;t fresh, everything tasted as if they were frozen. By that time in 3 hours the restaurant was already half empty, so not sure why there was still so much of a delay. All servers are running around but didn&#39;t seem to get anything done - probably short staffed. Multiple tables were having similar issues like us. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory is a popular chain in the nation, receiving such poor service and food was highly disappointing - most likely never going back. I wish them the best.

Service ain&#39;t the greatest here. We sat down for 20 mins and no one came around. I had to go to the front to ask for a waiter. I ordered a ribeye medium rare and it came out medium well, close to well done. I&#39;m not going to send it back because I would probably have to wait another 30mins or so. My final verdict is that cheese cake factory can not cook anything right when it comes to meat except for chicken. <br><br>To Cheesecake Factory, you do not have to reply to this or do anything. I wont be coming back anymore after the fifth time giving you guys multiple chances.

This Cheescake Factory branch is spacious and comfortable, but it lacks in service. We sat near the back and our waitress took our order right away. We didn&#39;t see her again until she brought our check. No refill&#39;s on drinks, or inquiry as to our satisfaction or needs. A lot of the wait staff were gathered around the hostess area, chatting, laughing and socializing. If you go here, bring your own Big Gulp from 7-11 because you won&#39;t see your wait staff after ordering.

EVERY time we go there, the restaurant is half empty, but the wait time is 30 minutes.  The &#34;brain trust&#34; that takes your name, size of party, etc. couldn&#39;t pour a glass of water between the three of them.  Don&#39;t waste your time!<br><br>The manger of this place must be an idiot.

My boyfriend and I had the nicest waiter! and the food was so good. When it&#39;s busy it takes long for fresh bread to come out but it&#39;s worth it. I recommend the Four Cheese Pasta and the Louisiana Pasta. the oreo cheesecake was amazing!

This is one of my favorite restaurants! There are so many items in the menu to choose from but my favorite is Louisiana Chicken pasta. The sangria is my go to drink. The appetizers are large enough to share or just to have as your meal. I always get the strawberry cheesecake and add fresh banana but I&#39;ve tried the Oreo and red velvet they are just as good.

We came to the Cheesecake Factory to celebrate my friend&#39;s birthday.  Yes, it&#39;s that kind of special occasion restaurant.<br><br>Let&#39;s say this, the menu is extensive and hasn&#39;t changed much over the years, but it&#39;s held up well.  The food is consistently good.  Our favorite items were still there including Avocado Eggrolls.  I will go into mourning and serious withdrawal if they ever take these off the menu.  The birthday boy ordered the Chicken Madeira, a longtime favorite, and I ordered the Chicken Piccata, another oldie but goodie. <br><br>We passed on the cheesecake, if you can believe it.  The birthday boy had been stuffed full of cake at work and couldn&#39;t stomach one more sweet without risking a sugar coma! <br><br>Service was impatient and served up with an attitude.  Always a bummer when you&#39;re trying to relax and enjoy a meal.
