I haven&#39;t been to this Cheesecake Factory since it moved over from further down Peachtree Road. Cheesecake Factory has always been a part of my Atlanta chain restaurant staples. My first experience at a Cheesecake Factory was at the original Buckhead Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>The wait on a Friday night was pretty long for 2 people. My sister and I got to the restaurant around 9:30PM and waited for about 25 minutes. We were seated in the back of the restaurant, and were constantly being interrupted by people leaving or entering the restaurant through the mall entrance in the back. We rarely saw our server, but were served our basic needs, albeit at a slow pace. My sister ordered a strawberry lemonade and it was SO sickly sweet. She asked for a free refill, but even my sister, Queen of sugary sweet things, couldn&#39;t finish a second glass. She ended up taking a to-go cup. <br><br>THAT BROWN BREAD THOUGH. I know it&#39;s not pumpernickel, but we trick ourselves into thinking it is so maybe it doesn&#39;t seem as unhealthy. Not that using an entire stick of butter on the bread is any better. It took a while to get to us, but once it did, it was soft and warm. <br><br>My sister and I split a pasta and an order of calamari. I got tired of the calamari real fast - my sister didn&#39;t like it so I ended up eating the whole $12 appetizer order of fried squid. It was just too much. I prefer not to take fried food to go, so I ended up leaving 1/4 of it there. My sister ordered the tomato basil pasta, and it wasn&#39;t too bad - just a standard pasta. My sister is a picky eater, and didn&#39;t like the pesto drizzle on top - that was NOT listed in the menu. She tried to eat around it, but as the trend goes, I ate most of her meal. <br><br>Overall, the food and service was at par, but that&#39;s about it.

Cheesecake has always been one of my favorite CHAIN restaurants! You would think that I would choose something else when visiting Atlanta but you can&#39;t go wrong with lunch at Cheesecake. Never knew Cheesecake had a Brussels sprouts salad but when I say...OMG...I mean OMG! I asked for them to add red onions and after the first bite, I fell in love. It was everything a mouth desires...crisp, fresh, nutty, and sweet. Oh and the service was good too! LOL

So we went to Cheesecake Factory to celebrate a coworker leaving our offices to go to another office. The food was good but as always the service was rather slow. No fault of the waitress she was absolutely great. She gave honest opinions of the food; and her favorite Cheesecake. <br><br>I chose to have a meal off the light options menu. Although I forget the name of it, it was delicious. I had a little room for dessert until I saw the size of the cake I selected. My advice to everyone who choose to eat there...DO NOT GO BACK TO WORK AFTERWARD. <br><br>Please see the pictures I post.

While the food at this location is usually better, the service is horrible. I&#39;ve come here several times for &#34;Happy Hour&#34; during my lunch hour (between 4pm-6pm) my order always takes approximately 45 minutes to be brought to me.  I&#39;ve continued to give them a chance to redeem themselves, however, I keep getting disappointed.  For example, I went in today at 5:30, and sat in the bar area for &#34;Happy Hour&#34;, and it took 15 minutes for a server come over to take my order, and I wanted an additional 30 minutes for my food to be brought out.  Needless to say, I had to eat in a hurry in order to get back to work so I wouldn&#39;t be late.  smh... Won&#39;t be back again...
my coworkers and i came for our lunch break. so that was on us thinking they would be fast. but no ! and they were rude.

Came to this location visiting a friend of mine that I haven&#39;t seen in months. We arrive and are greeted with the warmest welcome! So then we are taken to the Patio. While sitting on the patio we notice movement in the bushes and... YUP! Mice!!!  The waitress states &#34;They told me they fixed that problem&#34; and the manager states after that, and once he comes to the table &#34;we are fully aware of this problem!&#34;..... So why the entire H$&amp;&amp; are you sitting people out here one and two at least giving a heads up if you decide to sit people out here????? <br>Then we go inside because we do understand it&#39;s the mall, city and all that!!<br>So while inside we wait for our food. So when the food arrives at the table. It&#39;s not even warm!!!!!.<br>This is the worst ever experience I&#39;ve had at The Cheesecake Factory! Come on now‍‍.....<br>I will add that the manager did step in and attempt to make it better, but still this experience warrants 2 stars.
Consistent good food and service.  They handle the crowds well.  It is always packed on the weekends.
Sat at the bar while waiting to be seated. The bartender was complaining to the servers that they didn&#39;t tip him out enough after a previous shift. But the food was actually quite good.

The only thing that went right was that they provided the option for us to sit at the high bar seats instead of waiting 40 mins in line to sit at the booths/ tables. We had 2 birthday sundaes on the check, but only 1 came. Or rather, none, because it was just a whole cup of whipping cream. Ordered a latte but they came to tell us 45 mins later that the expresso machine wasn&#39;t working. End of story, 4 people had a lemonade, a cheesecake, and a cup of whipping cream after 1.5 hours of waiting. If we waited longer for our server to get return our credit card, we might spend 2 hours in the restaurant. We changed our mind and paid cash instead. We entered the restaurant at 3.30pm.

Management was terrible we sent food back and because we sent food back from the table we couldn&#39;t order anything else food was tasteless and when we wanted to exchange cheesecake he told us we would have to pay for the one we didn&#39;t like and  had to pay for 2 the one he didn&#39;t like and the one he actually wanted no exchange was given and it was more than one person who had sent their food back and they were very rude server and manger who came to the table did not try to make sure the guests were satisfied being that most of us worked in restaurant when comes to the guest usually they are willing to comp a meal no matter what it is and when we tried to make reservations they told us it&#39;s first come first serve and then when we get here the told us the wait was hour and a half and told us we should have made a reservation will NOT be coming back to this location.

The menu is HUGE, if they don&#39;t have something that tickles your fancy I would be impressed. I highly recommend the sweet corn tomale cakes. <br><br>Their cheesecake is awesome, no surprise. They have like 40 different flavors.
This location does NOT have as many selections of cheesecake but the servers were nice.

Who woulda known Cheesecake Factory had a happy hour  6.50 for a pretty wide selection of appetizers. I tried the buffalo blasts, Mex Tex and red velvet cheesecake! They were all delicious and my bill was under $25 woo hoo!

I&#39;m very disappointed in this location!!!  Service was a HOT MESS!!  First, we sat and waited at least 15 mins for a server to acknowledge us.  Then we placed our order and waited almost 30 mins for our food to come.  My husband order chicken and Waffles which came out cold.  Then the syrup well at least what they called syrup looked and tasted like melted butter.  Then when we asked the server for syrup he stated that was syrup...ummmm sir that&#39;s not syrup!!  I ordered the salmon which came out cold and undone with sauce on it that  I asked to put on the side.  I asked them to take my food back because it was cold.  They placed it in the oven and brought it right back. Lastly, it&#39;s 1:00 PM why are the bathrooms not properly stocked?  No soap and no toilet paper in some stalls.  Well this location has definitely lost my service!  I&#39;m never coming back here!!!!

Dornesha Was an outstanding server for us.  I didn&#39;t know there was going to be a wait for lunch but it was only 10 minutes.  I now understand why the &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34; was so busy...great food &amp; friendly employees.  I will defiantly come back to thi

I have been here twice now, and I have had nothing short of a satisfactory experience each time!<br>I will start with my recommendations; definitely try the Oreo Cheesy Milkshake. It comes in humongous quantity so order your other meals in moderation. If u r not a fan of Oreo shakes, there&#39;s chocolate and strawberry available too and both are pretty good.<br>Cheesecakes are another obvious winners here with almost 30 to 40 different options. On both occasions, we ate one there and packed another one for home for later indulgence.<br>I ordered pastas on each occasion so I do not have much to comment on the food section.<br>The servers have always been very polite and quick and responsive. I would recommend sitting outside rather than sitting inside, I felt a better and a more lively vibe outside rather than the cozy dark ambience on the inside.

Management failed to ensure good service. Our waiter was backed up with tables, we waited for our drinks long enough where we had to ask another waiter for our drinks. The manager came to our table and we told him our experience was bad, he didn&#39;t do anything for us, too bad!!!! Not only you lost a loyal customer, your waiter got a bad tip because of this shitty experience.

Love the food and love the menu. Don&#39;t pass up the Avocado Eggrolls. They are the best thing on the menu. There&#39;s something here for everyone, but make sure you&#39;re not in a hurry. It takes time, but it&#39;s worth it.

30+ minute wait for Togo service at Cheesecake Factory in Lenox square...tolerable. Servings about half the size at this price? Not okay. Super disappointed. Cashier ringing us up was very friendly despite the shear chaos however upon opening our food at home we discovered slices of cheesecake barely shareable.

I would give my experience here a zero if I could.  I ordered an Impossible burger (added bacon and avocado) and it was indisputably the worst burger I have ever had.  It took 40 mins for me to receive my burger (I noticed other tables received their dinners a lot sooner than mine) and the plate was soooooo hot that my toppings (lettuce, tomato, onion, and pickles) were steamed and wilted.  The avocado I paid extra for literally turned brown from the heat of my plate.  The ketchup on the side was so hot it felt like someone microwaved it. I admit I should have sent the burger back or asked for a manager, but I never saw my waitress until it was time to pay (she did stop by at the end to bring me the mayonnaise had requested when I ordered) and I was tired of waiting.  I resent paying $27 for a burger that was absolutely disgusting.

One star was only for the service we received from Janice. She was personable and hospitable. Otherwise, our experience was beyond subpar. We arrived at 1 PM for lunch. LUNCH. We weren&#39;t served our food until 2:30 PM. Our drinks took at least 20 minutes to come. A half hour after ordering, we were told one of the meals we ordered wasn&#39;t available. Appetizers came out at the hour mark - when we were supposed to be heading back to work. It was simply an unacceptable dining experience. Sarah, the manager, was semi-apologetic, but offered little more than a meager apology and a slice of cheesecake. I wasn&#39;t enthused or impressed. We should have gone somewhere else.

I am floored that this is an actual Cheesecake Factory. The hostess station was full of apathetic petiole who ordered people around without making eye contact. The server who brought sweet tea two times to a diabetic ( yes she was informed of the reason we asked for UNsweet tea, and got our order wrong. When the corrected order came back to the table it was apparent that the kitchen staff had scraped the sauce from the burger and slapped it on a new bun. Hello the sauce was still on the bottom of the burger. So disappointed. It&#39;s the Perimeter location for me from now on.

Not gonna lie shit is nasty. Service is horrible. This place has gone down hill management is ridiculous. This place is a joke. Vomit on the entry floor told the manager and he said &#34;we know&#34; then cleans it up without cloves and carried the red bag through the restaurant. No bread. No appetizers. No drinks.

Horrible service. They brought our food out cold so we sent it back. They then brought out one entree at a time with long waits between each entree so we couldn&#39;t even eat together.  No follow-up from the waitress. The manager came over and was completely worthless. Extremely disappointing. Will not step foot in this particular Cheesecake Factory again!
The service was a lil slow and the bartender wasn&#39;t very attentive but the drinks were very good.

I came here with my husband. This was out first time here at this location. I loved every experience. Food was good. Our server was really nice. The food was over cooked a bit but not too bad-- still edible. <br>It was busy at the time we went. But overall had a good time.
Two main were excellent. Cheesecake was fantastic (it was so good we forgot to take photo!) I&#39;m SO going back! Despite the calorie part, it can be a once a month thing!

I love this place. They have such a great menu it goes on for ever. And the portions that they serve are just on believable! I&#39;ve been coming here for 25 years and not just here in Atlanta I go in other cities as well. The worst part about cheesecake factory is that they&#39;re usually jam packed. But don&#39;t let that bother you come with a small group or come with a large group and you&#39;ll have fun but just be prepared you probably won&#39;t have room for dessert. Which is a shame because they&#39;re dessert menu is just out of this Galaxy.

I&#39;m surprised that I haven&#39;t written a review for this location since I&#39;ve been here about 3 times in the past 2 months.  First off, Cheesecake Factory is great because no matter who you dine with, there&#39;s always something on the menu for everyone. The menu takes at least 5-7 minutes or more to view from cover to cover.  That&#39;s why it&#39;s the perfect place to go to if you&#39;re just craving a predictable menu with solid service.  Oh, and I&#39;m sure most of you dine here for their dessert menu as well.<br><br>The last couple of times I was here, I went for a birthday brunch and happy hour.  Our brunch group was over 10 people and the service as stellar. We could not have asked for a better team of servers that took great care of us.  I ordered from their lo-cal menu and got their BBQ chicken salad. Portion size was perfect and my chicken was well cooked.  On another visit, I went to their happy hour on a weeknight with a dear friend, Morgan W., before heading to the YELPmas holiday party and sitting at the bar was quite the experience. Our bartender that night didn&#39;t quite understand that waiting 15-20 minutes for a drink order was frustrating because he just assumed his order was being handled by another team member.  Luckily for him, I wasn&#39;t in the mood to get i-rate so I just asked one more time for my friend to check on her drink order and that was all it took.<br><br>My last visit was yesterday and decided to order something complete different.  The Chicken Madeira was calling my name because it came with their infamous mashed potatoes and asparagus. My chicken was cooked well and had this delicious, tangy and sweet sauce that seemed soy sauce based.  I dug it and completed my entire plate. It came with about 2 pieces of chicken breast (grilled) topped with melted mozzarella cheese, sautéed mushrooms, and the grilled asparagus. YUM.  Our server was fantastic. She was on the ball and gave me my extra plate of lemons for my water and tea and made sure that our tea mugs were always half full.  Kudos to our server for taking great care of us on a busy Sunday!!  I look forward to returning for future happy hours during the week since my office is less than 10 minutes away and post shopping lunch and dinners.

Love cheesecake and their large variety menu. I have the specialty chicken with mango and it really light and refreshing ingredients combine together with a vinaigrette I believe . I like this location next to the mall everything is always great

What to do when you&#39;re staying st The Whitley and they want $30 for a burger.<br>Put on your coat and walk across the street to Cheesecake Factory! The <br>Skinnylicious menu has great- no lie! - options. Good, good food. And the staff at this restaurant is fantastic. We were waited on by B.B. What a lady! We went two nights in a row. On the Second night she remembered our names, our drinks, and what we&#39;d eaten on the first night. Both nights she was kind and patient and a gift to be with.<br>Grilled chicken won my heart both nights.

This is the second time In a row that our food has taken a long time to come out. I ask after 30 minuets and was told that the kitchen is behind. Less than 5 minuets later the people who came after us has there food and they had a burger like we did. Not even 5 minutes after that people who had not been seated 15 minutes received there burger. I didn&#39;t write about the last time but I had to this time. Typing this while I eat my warm not hot burger. SMH you need to do better!

Very disappointing experience last Friday 7/21/2019.<br>I work across the street and eat there often. Last Friday ordered lunch on the phone, walked over to pick it up. Specifically asked for bread. When I arrived Kelly R. at the counter said bread will be ready in 15 minutes and to come back. So I did come back. She then asked me to come back in 10 minutes and it will be ready. Came back again (mind you I&#39;m on a lunch break). She then said &#34;There will be no more bread&#34; WHAAAATTTTT????? And there was no apology of any kind. I also emailed the restaurant, and no answer.<br><br>Very unprofessional and I&#39;m pretty sure it was a lie.

Just like any other Cheesecake Factory. Giant long lines,,, eccentric décor and is usually one of the draws in the mall area. I mean really though, who can say no to Cheesecake Factory for dindin??<br><br>Anyways, people like me usually come to chain restaurants like these because of consistency. I know that my chicken marsala will consistently taste the same as I had it last time at the CF near my house. If not, close to what I had experiences. Which was the case when dined in. <br><br>My fiancé&#39;s shepherds pie however was a totally different story. The flavor was totally off. It was kinds gross actually. The kind of gross that he didn&#39;t even want to pack the leftover home. He actually ate my leftover chicken marsala for lunch the next day.<br><br>And no,, we&#39;re not the type to return food and not pay for it. That&#39;s where my reviews come in. The service was on point btw. <br><br>Thank you for reading my review. Have a yelptastic day!!

So the Cheesecake Factory, a place I used to say had great food despite the fact that it was a chain. I have been coming to the this place since I was a wee lass. It seems as with most places with time both the quality of food and service takes a nose dive. I have come to the Buckhead location a few times because of its proximity to the mall and the convenience. Each time my experience has been less and less pleasurable. Sitting there for 30 minutes before you are even acknowledged by the server. Luke warm food (how long was it sitting before you thought to bring it out) excuses for errors, as opposed to just taking ownership. And my number 1 complaint WHAT HAPPENED TO THE BROWNIE SUNDAE CHEESECAKE!!! I know, I have to blame corporate for that one. Anyway, the jambalaya is still pretty good, and the drinks are on point, but good ole Cheesecake Factory just ain&#39;t what it was. Notice, how I didnt talk about the cheesecake, no longer memorable.

We have been there 3 times in the last month, hoping to get better service. Love the menu but have been slighted and put at less diserable tables. Once we stuck out terribly cold weather to get lettuce wraps, while indoor tables were given to ppl who came in and knew those working there. We feel if we were a different race we would be treated differently. Sadly, I&#39;ve never felt this way but if you are Caucasian, you will not receive good service or priority for a decent table. I&#39;ve watched many come in and be seated ahead of us that were a different race. I used to love Cheesecake Factory

I came in on a Monday night which is considerably slower than the normal weekend Crowds. I could have Been seated but choose the fast bar top. After waiting 10 min without a menu or being greeted I had to move to the bar. 4 hostess stood and didn&#39;t offer anything and 3 waiters passed me by. Disappointing to say the least as they were not busy. However when I sat at the bar, I was promptly greeted by Lauren who took my order was friendly and apologized for any previous service. I really had a long trying day and sometimes service is Everything. I had my usual spinach and artichoke dip which was served hot and fresh chips fresh with large glass of sweet tea with lemon that was perfect. She was on top of refills and my tummy was happy. I hope management pays attention to the rest of the staff

Ordered the miso salmon and after only a few bites I was unable to eat anything for several days. I contacted the location and was given the run around 6 times by three different managers, Sarah(nice but phone was disconnected and couldn&#39;t get back in touch with her)Dustin (arrogant and dismissive)and Jared(put me on hold and never came back to the phone). Finally after being extremely persistent I got Dustin to actually speak to me and he said it was odd that I got sick, and odd that I still had the food and blamed me for the delay in speaking with them. But I guess according to Dustin my first order of business should have been to clean out my fridge and not get my strength back after not being able to hold anything down for 2 days.  Oh and I guess I should have rushed back to the Resturant after the holiday instead of doing what was more convenient for me and call. However, when you call you are left on hold for forever, have to call multiple times to speak to a manager and then have to hope and pray someone actually comes to the line. I&#39;ve spent countless of dollars at this location and will no longer patronage them after this experience. I filed a compliant with BBB, disputed the charges with my bank and sent their corporate office a certified letter. Hopefully this will result in a refund and not the bogus offer Dustin made of remaking the food or giving me a gift card to come back and experience the shame of a customer service they display. Bad fish isn&#39;t their only problem it&#39;s management as well. Now I understand why customer service is the way it is and I will not spend another dime at this location and if corporate doesn&#39;t respond I will be done with the entire brand.

When the lady and I checked in with the hostess, we were told it would be a 30 minute wait. During the 30+ minutes, which we waited patiently, we noticed that at least 3 tables remained open the entire time, where servers were on duty. The tables must have been out of order. After we were seated, we ordered drinks, Gin on the rocks, and a few appetizers, Fried Calamari, Buffalo Blast,  and a Greek Salad. The Greek salad was great, the calamari was cold, and the Buffalo blast was sent back to the kitchen. The server was friendly, but she totally kept forgetting to pick up the dirty plates from our tiny table for 2. The dirty plates sat at our table the entire time we were dining.  The overall experience here earned them 1 star in my book.

The service was alright, our waitress was new so didn&#39;t have much to suggest or an opinion to give on the food options. The food was not nearly as tasty as expected, i had the barbecue ranch chicken salad with no cucumber and i specifically asked to make sure on there being no cucumber, yet when our food was presented to us my salad had cucumber on it, and there was a major lack in the dressing, no flavor at all and hardly any barbecue ranch. I felt like i was just eating lettuce. My husband had the chicken enchiladas which were smaller than expected and lacked in moisture. Very dissatisfied with the food, but will be back for the cheesecake only.

Food was really good-the main reason for giving it a three. The customer service was terrible. There were three guest at my table including myself. Two of us ordered pasta- lasagna and then chili pasta, the other ordered garlic herb chicken. As we waited over 30 minutes for our food- the tables that sat down after us had their food immediately, which included pasta. The manager came to our table and said &#34;sorry! The lasagna is taking forever to make&#34; -well the lasagna showed op first and the chili pasta took another 8 minutes after the lasagna arrived. We received our meal as the tables around us(that arrived at least 10min after us) were paying and leaving their tables. In addition, never really saw our waitress, there was a span of 20 minutes where we never saw her. We really wanted to order cheesecake, because who doesn&#39;t when you&#39;re at CCF, but since we waited so long for our food and the poor customer service- we wanted to get out of there. <br><br>Luckily, the food was great- if it wasn&#39;t I would have given negative stars if it was possible.

So I haven&#39;t been to Cheesecake Factory in a long time so I thought why not!  I am trying to eat better so I ordered off the skinnylicious menu!  The Asian lettuce wraps were the best I have ever had!!  I like that they are already wrapped not a mess that I need to create.  I also had the edamame and it was ok the Sangria was also good!! It was a typical crowd with a short line. I didn&#39;t realize they have happy hour from 4-6 and had just missed it!!! I will be back!!!

My daughter and I came in on. Tuesday night at approximately 10:00.<br>The wait time was about 20-25 minutes.<br>It took an unusually long time just to get our drinks and even longer for our appetizers (30 minutes to be exact).  Management did explain the cook burned one of the appetizers, that explains the delay for the chicken quesadillas .<br>To top things off, we used the rest rooms which was in a horrible state (not clean at all).  I had to ask an employee to please make sure management takes care that.<br><br>Last but not lest, I wanted to order a slice of strawberry cheesecake to go however they were out <br><br>I will say that I&#39;ve visited this location at least a half dozen times before and this is my first bad experience.  If that was not the case, this recipe would have one star.  <br>!
They told us it would an hour wait, but were seated in less than 10 minutes. Great service and awesome cheesecake! No dinner this time, just dessert.

Terrible. Me and a girl both ordered a whiskey on the rocks. At first I was amazed by how much they poured, and gave the bartender a compliment saying thanks for the big pours randomly. When I got my bill she charged us both a double. You don&#39;t pour doubles without asking the customer... wtf?<br><br>Never coming back here again.

Not a good location to go to. 80 minute waits when there were whole sections open. We started out ordering 2 entrees and an appetizer. The entrees made it to the table a good 30 minutes before the appetizer - no grated cheese was offered for either and no apologies either. Drinks remained empty for up to 15 minutes. When we ordered cheese cake the waitress remarked &#34;oh, is this for here?&#34; Returning to literally throw the plate onto the table without bringing forks or refilling drinks. We asked a team member to speak with a manager, they acted as they were going to get one and then stated bringing out food for another table. The waitress returned and threw the check on the table and waited for the payment to be placed in it as if she was rushing us out - no manager ever showed up. <br><br>Update: contacted customer service per comment, a week after no response.

I have a bit of a love-hate relationship with the Cheesecake Factory. In general I like the food, it&#39;s always tasty and the portions are huge. The problem is the long waits to be seated and an overall lackadaisical attitude from the servers. Oh they&#39;re very attentive when around, but at times it seems half the table needed drinks and the server was taking a break or something. Who knows? My second gripe is with the menu - just too many choices. My thought is that everything can&#39;t be good? as they&#39;ll have to keep so many ingredients ready that it seems there would be a lot of spoilage.  At least my crispy Asian salad was tasty.

Unimpressed. <br><br>Ordered a burger and it was half the size of the buns, fries were bland and it didn&#39;t even come with everything the menu said it was coming with ( I didn&#39;t get pickles, onion or tomatoes).<br><br>Waste of time &amp; money honestly, they aren&#39;t as fancy as they act like they are ....<br>just get a slice of cheesecake to go.

At first the bartender was very rude. We sat and waited while he made drinks right in front of us. He came n went a few times and never acknowledged us. After 5 minor so we asked for menus. He rolls his eyes and grabs two menus and places them in them in the bar not in front of us... Just on the bar. Never once made eye contact.  We just got up and made out way to the host stand to get a table.<br><br>Hosts were hosts and no complaint there.<br><br>Our server is the reason for 5 stars. She was knowledgeable, sweet, prompt and made sure we were taken care of!!

Writing this review while I am still here, still standing and waiting for a table after more than 45mins wait. The buzzer buzzed some time ago, we handed the buzzer to the hostess. She took the buzzer from us, did not say a word and turned away from us. We are clueless, not sure when we are getting our table. Finally someone called one of my friend&#39;s name, we followed her just to be told to wait again as table was not ready. No apologies, nothing. Yup, we are the dumb people who chose to come here and being snubbed by this 5 star fancy restaurant. We deserve to be treated badly! Seriously???<br><br>The lack of basic customer service among the hostess(es) was appalling. Why are these incompetent people even here?? Yes, the place was busy, people kept coming in and the inadequate of proper place to accommodate those who were waiting for a table. But that is no excuse to be rude and snooty. By the way, whoever designed this place is a joke. People were standing in front and everywhere simply because there is no designated area for them to wait for their table.<br><br>More waiting... Finally.. Our table is ready.. (To be continued) ...<br><br>It&#39;s 10pm now, just got home.. <br><br>Continuing from earlier...<br><br>After almost 2 hours, my friends got their food. Shortly, a gentleman came to our table (whom I  believed to be the manager) started apologizing, letting me know the fish &amp; chips I ordered has gone missing. He said he has already asked the kitchen to redo the fish &amp; chips and it would be out shortly in a minute or two. I felt a lot better even though my fish &amp; chips has gone AWOL, at least someone came and informed me and apologized for the wait. Our server, David, who has been very nice all these while also came and apologized about the long wait for the food. <br><br>Based on that only, I have gone ahead and amended my review draft from a 1 star to 3 stars. <br><br>Food was good but I supposed a piece of bread will be just as tasty. I was starving since like about 3 hours ago.<br><br>At the end of the night, the check came and David told me they have taken off the fish &amp; chips. I thanked him for that, took care of the bill and off we left. We lived like a couple of minutes away from the mall. By the time I got back home, it was like 10pm. <br><br>It was a disaster to come here for dinner. Guess the manager and our server managed to save this place by helping to bump this review from a 1 to 3 stars. <br><br>Phew!! What a night!!

Went to this location today around 4pm. I got the worst customer service. They had a cakes half off today. That they wouldn&#39;t even honor. They been rude and stingy! I was embarrassed on front of other customers. I just left without getting a cake. It&#39;s to much to write on here. I will never go back. This place hired classless lady&#39;s in cake department. It&#39;s the older lady in there.<br><br>So after my review I been contacted by Cheesecake Factory representative, we talked on the phone they ask me questions about situation. They said they going to take action and discipline the staff at this location. I am happy about it because they could have just ignored me. Instead they called me even give me a gift card for free cake. Thank you so much Cheesecake Factory!!  So I am giving them 4 star for caring enough to contact me:)

This review is solely based on my waiting experience. We put our name in the system, they took our phone number, and told us a wait time of 60-85 minutes. 40 minutes later, a different family, same amount of folks come in and they were told a shorter wait time. They were sat ten minutes later. We go in to speak with the team and they told us that the computers do this and blah blah. So I go in and I speak with a manager and tell him the story and how we were sat later - I told him we could continue to wait as needed but a discount on the food would greatly appreciated. He had a bit of an attitude and didn&#39;t really seem to listen. <br><br>I think on a management side, the customer is ALWAYS right. He told me everything I told him was based on perception and he can&#39;t discount perception. I was about to go full swing, but I remembered my day job and calmed down.  I think this was poor behavior on the manager&#39;s part and he would benefit from some interpersonal training. <br><br>He did proceed to seat us immediately but his attitude ruined what could have been a two-star review.

I went on a busy night while in Atlanta on vacation. I sat on the patio, which made the experience much greater! Although, it was 60 degrees outside the heaters kept us nice and toasty. I loved the atmosphere and ambiance the setup created. My waitress was not the best. She barely came to see if we were ok and when she did stop by the table it was to let myself and my party know she hadn&#39;t eaten all day and would be missing because she was hungry. A horrible waitress however, did not ruin the night. I had the Pizza style Chicken Alfredo, It was delicious! The others with me raved about their food as well. Lastly, we all split a slice of cheesecake which was also delicious. I give this place 9 out of ten stars!

Cheesecake factory as we all know is a popular chain.  The decor, ambiance, the food menu pretty much is standard and consistent.  What maybe different going to each one is the service. The service at this location is pretty good or usually is at this location.  Whether you come here for brunch, dinner, lunch portions...they have what you may want.  The pizza is pretty decent. That&#39;s the only thing I will add onto this review that I was quite surprised.  Not saying it&#39;s good as NY Pizza but pretty ok for that chain&#39;s standards.  The cajun pasta is the go to menu item here!  Good place, and can get crowded on the weekends.<br><br>Grade: B

Cheesecake Buckhead...great location for shopping and eating. Awesome duo. When in doubt, the bar is the best location, while solo. The bartender was very attentive and since it was happy hour and I wasn&#39;t starving I ordered &#34;small plates.&#34; Great portion size. The whiskey paradise punch is a plus! <br>I suggest Cheesecake during your holiday shopping at Lenox!

Came for a late dinner, about 9:00.  We were seated on the patio and our server seemed to be unable to manage the tables that she was sat.   They weren&#39;t a full house, though.  <br>I didn&#39;t get my entree until 30 minutes after everyone else at the table.   We never got refills for our drinks.  Our empty plates sat in front of us as we waited almost an hour, trying to get our checks.   We ended up going to a manager to get our check and complain, and the manager didn&#39;t seem to care about our issues.   Never had such an experience at one of these locations.

It has a great ambiance and the carrot cheese cake is one thing that one should not miss if you are visiting this place!!!!!<br><br>Now saying that, although the food is great, the only problem is the waiting. I had to wait for 40 minutes and when I tried making reservation on the phone beforehand, they said we don&#39;t take phone reservations.<br><br>Overall the place is very nice but the waiting part takes the thunder away.

Me and my girls usually meet at the Lenox location on Fridays from 4-6pm for happy hour. This is the best time to go in my opinion because the restaurant is not crowded and you can be sat easily.  The staff can also be more attentive rather than when they are busy and you have to wait for them to remember you are sitting. All in all, my favorite location and the food is always good.
Ordered wings extra crispy, they were soggy and not fully cooked!Seemed more baked than fried, sauce was really salty

I would normally not even give this place any stars but since that&#39;s not an option and i have to give something I would be quick to give 1 star because I have never liked anything here but luckily I came across 1 thing on the 30 page menu that I do like.. avocado toast! Blame the millennial in me but once again avocado comes in to save the day. Oh! ...the bread they bring out first is pretty yummy too, and duh you should be lucky enough to find a cheesecake that you like. Hey to each his own some people love this place buttt if you don&#39;t try the avocado toast and you might hate it a little less. <br><br>**how do I change my rating? The customer service here is horrible.. I take that back I&#39;ve been here 3 times and have sat at the bar all 3 times and it is so horrible the lack of attention these bartenders pay guests. I keep coming back for this avocado toast but going forward I&#39;m thinking I just need to order it to go so I don&#39;t even have to deal with the negligence and lack of concern from these bartenders.

Very good presentation! Haven&#39;t been in a while but enjoyed the Chicken Parmesan Pizza style... Also enjoyed the lightly fried zucchini. Ended the dinner with a to-go order of Salted Caramel Cheesecake... Huge portions

If you like Cheesecake Factory like I use to don&#39;t go to this location.  Me and my husband drove 40 mins for brunch every other Sunday and the service gets worse.  The food is cheap and taste is very consistent the  manager is useless!!! I don&#39;t tell you my situation to get a free desert, he seemed lost with situation and just offered a slice of desert. The service here is horrendous!!! And don&#39;t bother doing the survey they don&#39;t reply or call you back.  <br><br>The brunch is however great but Olive Garden is where is at for me personally. I will miss those wheat bread as well.  I almost rented out this lousy place for my 30th birthday so glad I didn&#39;t.  I did have it at Olive Garden.

We went to the Cheesecake Factory restaurant at the Lenox Square Mall yesterday (2/28/16) and I had mixed feelings about the visit, so I decided to give myself 24 hours cool down before writing this review. <br><br>First, the Cheesecake Factory is a chain. We have eaten at various other stores and are familiar with their offerings. As usual, have rave reviews for the food and drink. Everything was delicious, well-seasoned and the quality I like to see at restaurants. In addition, our server Brittany was fast, efficient and very pleasant. Cudos all around for her performance.<br><br>Where this visit went off the rails was at reception. The hostess was nice, but seemed a little frazzled. We were given a 40-minute wait time and instructions on how to respond to the page to my cellphone. Waits at Cheesecake Factory are business as usual, so we took a seat outside. As we waited, I counted 5 empty (dirty) tables waiting to be bussed. The hostess actually cleaned one of the tables when she came to seat guests, but the remaining four were dirty the entire time we watched during our wait.<br><br>After we were paged and went inside, there was another queue to wait in for a hostess to seat us. Once again, I counted 3 booths and a table (visible from where we were standing) that were dirty and in need of clearing before seating other guests. A number of other guests who had already been paged were lining the walkway and waiting to be seated. (This design created an obstruction to the walkway and a potential hazard.) As we were seated, I noticed that in places the floors were slippery, but this could have been just a spot or two of water spilled on the floors.<br><br>While we enjoyed our meal, I did notice that a manager was clearing tables, so it&#39;s possible this was an isolated incident, but this is the type of thing that spreads ripples through an entire service. Uncleared tables lead to decreased capacity and longer wait times. These in turn poorly flavor the guest experience and affect return visits. Our visit was early (3pm) Sunday afternoon, not during the busiest service at all. All things considered, we&#39;re happy with the food, but with other comparable competition, no longer make The Cheesecake Factory a regular dining experience.

My friend and I ate here twice during the America Mart! Our favorite was Steak Diane! Both times we ate there it was a 45-60 wait. First time it was on a Wednesday and second time on a Saturday night at about 8:30. I&#39;ve rated at other cheesecake factories in different states and this one is really good! The cooks were kind of slow though.
Love their 5 cheese pasta! This is my go to restaurant anytime I&#39;m in Atlanta! I also love getting the chocolate cake with strawberries added to the top! So good!

We came in from the side entrance of Lenox Mall.  The restaurant was not busy and the hostess pleasantly greeted us.  Comparing to the Dunwoody location,  the food just wasn&#39;t the same.  My server was right next to us when the server assistant brought out our entrées.  She did not take away our appetizer plates and asked us to put them on top of the wooden counter.  Hello?  The server was standing right next to us.  The portions were big but the foods have a bland taste compared to the Dunwoody location.  I gave this location 2 chances, but I don&#39;t think I will ever  come back here again.
Michael literally worked out the logistics to seat my party of 26 in minutes, gave us 4 servers, and they served up amazing food and cheesecake! Loving that lemon cello cake!!!!

I love the food at this place, but service is terrible. My friend and I went to the Lenox location and apparently the hostess was having a bad day. She was very rude to us and would not even acknowledge our presence at the restaurant. Finally after being seated, the waiter came and took our order, we told the the waiter about our experience and he knew exactly what and who we were talking about as if he has heard this complaint before! <br>     The waiter summoned the manager to our table so that we could tell our story and it looks as if he had heard this story a thousand time. We finally ordered our cheesecakes and the waiter had to come to us 4 times to apologize because it took them an hour to get our cheesecakes to us. The manager did give us the cheesecakes free, but I would rather have the Great Experience instead of the free cheesecakes any day. Please, Please, Pretty Please work on your hospitality especially at the front because that person sets the tone for the Experience! Thank you.
Took too long to get my food! Highly upset. I&#39;ve waited over and hour and still no spicy chipotle chicken pasta!

I&#39;ve been to this location a couple of times and must say that it remains a solid 3 star visit. The service has been hit or miss, which is the primary reason for the low stars. <br><br>Upon check in, the staff always seems in overwhelmed mode, and can be on the rude side. I asked both times to be seated outside. The first visit I was seated right away, the second time I was told there would be a 15 minute wait, and there was very few people seated outside. Now I don&#39;t mind waiting, but after 25 minutes, I was still seated inside, after being told that there was no available tables outside. I do like the fact that you can enter your phone number and receive a text message when your table is ready. However, when you receive that text message, be prepared to wait at least another 10 minutes while someone else comes over to help you, or as they stand there looking at you, holding your seating fate in their hands.<br><br>The location is very nice inside. When I sat outside, we were able to have the heater turned on making for a very comfortable environment. On the inside, the place was extremely loud and the table was cramped. Not to mention the people seated next to me thought it was a good idea to enter my personal space with their chairs. Definitely not the best dining experience as I had to ask the woman twice to move over, as her hair ended up in my food both times. The waitress just kind of shrugged at me after the woman refused to move over, and had I not been an adult, I would have just dumped my dinner on her since her hair was in it anyway. <br><br>Now to the food. I&#39;ve tried the buffalo wings on both occasions, and they are very good. I also tried the fried mac and cheese which was delicious. I like the skinnylicious menu as well. I&#39;ve tried the cajun jambalaya pasta dish which was delicious, just the perfect amount of spicy, as well as the grilled salmon, although a slight bit overcooked, still moist and delicious. The portions are large, and the pricing fair for what you&#39;re getting. Drinks wise, I&#39;ve tried the pina colada, the tropical martini, and the pineapple mojito, all of which were good on the amount of alcohol and fantastic on flavor. <br><br>The best part about the Cheesecake Factory is, and will always be the cheesecake. I always get the red velvet cheesecake as it is my favorite. Save lots of room for the cheesecake, the portion is huge, and extremely filling. This place certainly does cheesecake right. <br><br>Now, if only they can get the service improved, the rating would improve. But I&#39;ll eat here again for the cheesecake alone.

Came here for dinner around 9:15 for dinner we order the 2 glasses of wine with the Honey Truffle Chicken.... Mike Snyder was the Dining room manager who was unconcerned<br><br>Everything was ok until the dinner was delivered

TERRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!  We waited over an hour after we were seated one hour before closing time. Watched 3 tables get seated, served &amp; pay while we sat &amp; waited on our food! The waiter told us it was taking so long because they cook everything from scratch...REALLY?!  When our food finally came we refused it &amp; just paid for our drinks. I would not recommend this location!

I ordered Bang bang shrimp and chicken for today&#39;s lunch from doordash and I was shocked at how bad it was. It delivered with all burnt shrimps and sauce was too bland. Nothing taste!! No star at all for this food but I had to throw in a star to get the review to show up. I had to throw it away. I paid $28 for this food with all tips and money down the drain.

First, it took us about 10 minutes to get seated in an empty restaurant. Once we got seated, we didn&#39;t have a server and had to wait for our water for 20 minutes. We eventually got it, after we had to remind our freshly assigned waiter about it. 40 minutes later, once we got our food in this empty restaurant, we were blown away. One of the orders included &#34;fresh fruit&#34;, pictures of which you can see attached. We did not want the kids eating it, so we called for a manager to talk about it. The manager, Denise, told us that the fruit was frozen and thats why it looked this way. We don&#39;t really know why you call frozen fruit fresh, but Denise didn&#39;t want to try out the blueberries. Overall, the conversation was as unpleasant as our experience in this establishment, and i would recommend looking elsewhere for brunch.

This was my first time at the Cheesecake Factory and my girlfriend and I received the worst service from the beginning. When we arrived we went to the host stand where we chose a table inside. The host said it would be &#34;less than 5 minutes&#34; as time went by people JUST arriving were repeatedly getting sat. After waiting another 10 minutes they noticed we still hadn&#39;t been sat so they checked the computer and apparently someone put that we were already at the table and apologized for the mis communication and wait. Our server Dajah was very attentive at the beginning for our initial order. We got our appetizers and was honestly not impressed with one of them. We were going to tell the server that they weren&#39;t what we were expecting and to see if we could get something else or just get them taken off. But she never came to check on us. We finished the other appetizer and the bread that was on the table. And pushed the plates to the edge. Now the 2 people tables are not very big at all. When the food runner came with our food we could barely fit the two large plates on the table. We had both requested Cajun seasoning in the pasta and mines was still very plain, I wanted to ask for more seasoning but again the server never came to see how the food was. She eventually came by again where we then waved her down to get the checks and to-go boxes. She came back to confirm who got which entre. When she brings the bills I noticed she still somehow mixed up the entres. I call her over and ask her to switch the entres and then to go ahead and run the cards she then looks me dead in the eyes with SO much attitude says &#34;Are you sure you want me to fix it? It&#39;s going to take a long time because I have to get a manager for that.&#34; Seriously?  YES I want it fixed. First and last time, would not recommend.

Let me first start off by saying that TCF is one of my FAVORITE eateries to go to. The ambience at Lenox Square is very nice and compliments the area. The only problem I had was the rush (I went on a Friday night) and that the wait was almost an hour. But our server was great and speedy despite the crowd. The fettuccini alfredo I had was certainly delicious and the Hershey&#39;s chocolate cheesecake was the highlight of my meal, of course. Very nice restaurant to go to. If you&#39;re a weekender and are patient; I recommend it!

This was my second time here and the second time the service was terrible. Brittany was our server and if you get in her section bring some crackers. She&#39;s terrible. We ended up having to get the manager to check on our food and then the waitress wouldn&#39;t come to our table after that. It might be better in another server&#39;s area but I was not impressed and don&#39;t know if I&#39;ll be back.

Cheesecake Factory<br><br>Pros: Location, Cheesecake &amp; menu selection <br><br>Cons: Service<br><br>I like the atmosphere and I love the location of this Cheesecake Factory, however the service here is hit or miss. With that being said, I don&#39;t go here very often. I&#39;ve had a few experiences where the waiter wasn&#39;t very helpful, if the waiter was available at all. The food is ok but it&#39;s not something that makes me want to tell all my friends about it. The best thing about this location is the fact that it&#39;s attached to Lenox mall, the cheesecake and the beautiful atmosphere. <br><br>They could do a better job with making sure the staff treats every customer with superior customer service. <br><br>Overall my experience at the Cheesecake Factory could have been better but due to the amount of restaurants in the Atlanta area I don&#39;t have to go to the same place over and over again. <br><br>I only recommend this location if your looking for amazing cheesecake. If you do go here I sincerely hope your waitress/waiter understands the importance of customer service.

Seriously what positive thing has not been said about TCCF. All of us had wonderful meals. I had the Cuban Sandwich myself amazing. Then this lovely cheesecake here really hit the spot, very sweet n rich. Always a joy to go to the TCCF.

I do not recommend this location. As a woman in the service industry myself I know and realize the importance of tips therefore as long a service is swell I will leave 20% or more!! My friend and I were seated around 6:04pm and watched waiters pass by us until about 6:26 with no water or silverware, I finally stopped someone and asked who our waiter was. After he went back and forth with a few people we were passed off by the initial waiter and the kind waiter who I stopped ended up helping us. I feel like we were passed off because we &#34;looked like&#34; we may not have tipped well, but WE DID and always do! We spent $130 (just us 2) and tipped a little over 20% despite how we were overlooked for 20 mins!

This is a beautiful restaurant in beautiful location. Our server Tina was great and very attentive, even though she was very busy and had a lot of tables to take care of. The food is always good here and it is pretty consistent. One disappointment was that the draft beer was not ice cold. I love my beer very cold and this was not even close to cold. Other than that it was good as always.

The hostess was really friendly and got us in pretty quick. <br><br>Cooper was our server tonight and he was awesome. Very attentive, down to earth,  friendly, and great with my little guy! <br><br>Food was great: I got the healthy grilled salmon and veggies -- done perfectly! So good!!! And a big portion! My dad got the Cobb salad and switched the dressing-- delicious. And my little guy got the kids pasta w butter and parm-- tasty and he&#39;ll have leftovers for lunch! Perfect! <br><br>Then came Bebe (BiBi?). She stole the show! Haha She wasn&#39;t our server, but she saw my three year old being fidgety and trying to escape from the booth. She swooped in and asked if she could hold him and being the overly friendly guy that he is, he went straight into her arms. She asked if she could take him to the open kitchen lol I needed a mama break-- take him please! lol I watched her take him up and down the food line and show him everything and say hi to everyone. Then she put him on her hip like she did this every day, and continued to check on other tables, at the same time hahaha I love her! My child was loving this. And so were the customers. She had him help her swipe the credit card and press the buttons lol and then got him strawberries as she picked up someone&#39;s cheesecake order. You can tell she&#39;s a natural with kids, but also that she just naturally goes above and beyond for people. She was so great, and I truly needed that mama break! Thank you for having such great customer service and loving servers! <br><br>I just moved here from Cali, and we&#39;ll be back for sure to this location!

The Cheesecake Factory is a lot like a diner - there&#39;s a little bit of everything, and it&#39;s all OK. Obviously, the cheesecake is really good. But the portions are both over the top on calories and incredibly expensive, especially for what&#39;s not much better than diner food. This does tend to be a popular option when family comes to visit; otherwise, I wouldn&#39;t come back for anything but dessert.

Let me start by saying...oh, how I love this franchise! Imagine my disappointment when I received such awful service at this location. I really hate to only give them 2 stars but this location deserved it. Poor service!<br><br>So, I went to this location a couple of weekends ago around 3:30pm. We were told it would be an hour wait for a party of two. We ended up waiting almost an hour and a half. But I was excited to show the place off to a newbie so we waited.<br><br>I&#39;ve been to other locations - Jacksonville, FL, Miami, FL, Cherry Hill, NJ, and Charlotte, NC. I knew what to expect as far as decor and prices. Yes, they are pretty pricey but it has been worth it at every visit EXCEPT this one. The service was just awful. No other word for it. I had a spicy pasta and had to stop several other waiters for a refill as our waitress literally took our orders and brought the check. I asked her for a refill and she said ok but I saw her walk past several times. The food was so subpar here. The bread they give you was cold and hard. The table next to us had to send their pizza back because the bottom was completely burned and black. The cheesecake never disappoints though. It was great as per usual. <br><br>Needless to say my Cheesecake Factory newbie was not impressed. Better luck at another GA location, hopefully.

This place is packed on a Friday night around 9pm. The line for a table was so long, I decided to to the fast to-go line for a dessert. Since I don&#39;t love cheesecake, I went with the apple crisp. Wow. Two generous scoops of vanilla ice cream and enough apple crisp for 6 people. Excellent value! We took our to-go order and ate outside at the Starbucks tables (no one else was there).
Was very busy and took a while to get food but it was good.  Food was kind of bland but fresh.  The staff was helpful and took care of us but this location was very busy.
My family and I have eaten here many times! The entrees and appetizers are good but the cheesecake is where it&#39;s at! You won&#39;t be disappointed!

TO-GO Review - The worst! It&#39;s unreal. No matter what you order or when. Tacos in a lettuce wrap - come out wrong and then there is attitude about it. Fix it!! We order apps and tacos. How do you mess this up? Never again. Never. The lady beside me came back twice - to get the correct food she ordered. <br><br>The issue is - there&#39;s no proper method to store the food while the customer comes to pick it up. And on top of that the To-Go line is mixed with cheesecake orders and then the To-Go orders. Last, it never helps that the actual employees are chatty nonstop amongst themselves. And totally not paying attention. There needs to be a manager there. To control the Chaos.

Don&#39;t go on a weekend night!!!!!! Unless you don&#39;t mind waiting 2 hours while tables sit empty, cleaned and ready for customers for over 20 minutes, I get the whole &#34; we will<br>Call you when your table is ready&#34; gambit, but seriously seat your waiting customers ASAP if tables are ready not at the time YOU say.....because trust me the hostess WILL MAKE YOU WAIT THE TIME....<br>Miss Chantel the <br>Hostess was very rude, servers are rushed. all in all a very unpleasant experience one I won&#39;t be doing again!
not any too special but great food! the cheesecake was phenomenal!! service was pretty slow and it took awhile to get our food and the restaurant wasn&#39;t very full.

POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE, PERIOD. They aren&#39;t busy but the wait time is forever, the food takes forever, just poor service overall. I would not recommend this place to anyone, it&#39;s not even worth the wait.
Due to great customer service, kudos to management for taken care of my solution with my order!

Typical Cheesecake except this one seems to be less busy than the one in Sandy Springs and smaller. I guess its because this is considered a cheaper alternative in Buckhead and also a bit boring with all the great restaurants buckhead has to offer. We just choose this place because it was in the mall so it was easy and convenient and ricky wanted his lunch cocktail and I wanted the bread lol.

The time visited cheesecake factory. A very busy restaurant and you have to wait for a table. The waiter was nice, she provided soda and bread on time as long as we finished. The food is not too bad too (although i think it is a little bit too high). We also ordered the cheesecake, but the lime is denfinity too sour for me lol.
The food was marvelous and the service was excellent too!!! We celebrated my BigBro&#39;s Birthday!!!
Bad services, Food was okay. Wait 30 or more just get refill drinks. Never going back.

They&#39;ve messed up on multiple orders when delivering. My recent order was missing 4 items!! I tried to call and make my case but they put me on hold for over 10 minutes. Wasn&#39;t even worth it at that point. They&#39;re entirely disorganized.

The Cheesecake Factory at Lenox Square Mall is amazing for its ambience. The lightings of the restaurant are dim and yellow, the concept of the restaurant décor is mixed, it can be romantic but also suitable for groups and gatherings. There is a bar too, so the noise level is quite high and not suitable for business meals. The seats at dining area were not very comfortable, the tables are quite small for two especially if you are going to order a lot of food. <br><br>I came on a Saturday, the restaurant was crowded, however, not difficult to get a seat. The staffs at the front desk were attentive and they serve you right away when you entered. Few tables were assigned to each waiter/waitress, so he/she will definitely be attentive to serve you. I was quite satisfied with my waitress. At times, she was too busy serving other tables, but she came back to check and apologized. <br><br>Before the meals hit the table, I was served with two different kinds of fresh baked breads, brown honey wheat bread and sourdough. The breads were soft and served hot, goes well with butter. <br><br>I ordered the Cabonara spaghetti pasta Smoked Bacon, Green Peas, and a Garlic-Parmesan Cream Sauce and Tortiglioni pasta with meatballs. The portion of the dishes were filling, pastas were cooked well and the taste was quite ok. I would say a 5/10.<br><br>As for dessert, I ordered a lemon raspberry cream cheesecake. The cheesecake was a little wet and too sweet, too much whipped cream. I was quite disappointed as I was having high hopes on Cheesecake Factory since cheesecakes are their main iconic food. I give it a 4/10.<br><br>I will still visit again when I crave for dessert, willing to give it another try. The service is great, the ambience is nice, the food was ok, slightly costly. Overall Rating 5/10.

I used to love the Cheesecake Factory but I will no longer waste my money here. The place has a dirty smell, the food is always disappointing, and the service can vary from slow to just plain odd. I got sick from eating here 6 months ago but decided to give them another chance. After I was served a dusty slice of cheesecake (with brown specks on a white cheesecake) that looked like last night&#39;s leftovers (I was afraid to even eat it), I knew I would never give them my money again.

I have not been to The Cheesecake Factory in over 4 years... I used to be a regular at their location in Virginia Beach Town Center. Stopped in to kill time while family was shopping.  I love patio seating and their patio was cute and inviting. It was pretty crowded inside the restaurant but I was seated fairly promptly. My server, Pierre, was upbeat and attentive. I received my wine and food in a timely manner. Everything was hot and delicious. I will have to visit again for my old favorites from the menu.
My food was really good and the staff was attentive even though they were very busy. I got this bacon burger and the cheese was delicious. I would go again.

Probably the worst Cheesecake Factory we&#39;ve ever been to.  It started out with the demeanor of the hostess who had no customer service skills at all.  Food was mediocre and the waitress was less than average.

Very classy and very delicious. <br><br>The server was extremely respectful although a little slow.  <br> They have delicious drinks and the food menu is huge!<br><br>They have options for everyone. OH and their bread is delicious .<br><br>I order fried macaroni as my appetizer since I ate so much bread. It was as amazing as it sounds..and I even combined bread and macaroni and fell in more love.  I also got strawberry lemonade that wad equally delicious <br><br>Besides being a little expensive, you pay for the ambience and the food!

Cheesecake Factory is like a buffet. Tons to choose from, but the quality may not really be there.  I have had good stuff here and I have had bad stuff here.  It&#39;s the luck of the draw really.  It&#39;s your typical American dishes with a little flair by adding a new skinnylicious menu and large portions.  The salads I have to say are really good! The cheesecake is even better. So many choices, so little time.  Good thing they have a walk up counter for the cheesecake so you don&#39;t have to dine in to get some. <br><br>I was annoyed at the hostess stand because we had a party of 5 and of course they don&#39;t seat until the whole party is there. Fine, those of us who are there are checked in.  But when our party was fully there, we had to wait? So I am confused because logic tells me I been had my name on the list, we checked in, we are now all here, then I should be next, right???? Nope we had to wait, and wait too long where we had to say something.  No Bueno in my book.  <br><br>Our server was nice; she was just a little bit busy. The food took a little time to come out so I was thankful for the bread.  The bread is great comes out warm.  The butter should be room temperature as well. Overall ok experience.

I am honestly shocked that this place is a three. If you have ever had the Cheesecake Factory the name alone is a three and everything else is just a plus. The only reason I am giving this place a four instead of a perfect is because of the wait time after we were done eating and the time it took for the waiter to come back and provide us with the desert menu. I will say that we came right with they opened so it was very easy to get a seat. Also, I asked the seater for a table and he gave us a booth (I didn&#39;t bother to correct him). The variety of food is too much as always. I was switching back and forth between a salad and macaroni burger. I thought it was a little crazy that the salads were almost $20, so I ended up getting a burger. I guess part of the price is the experience. Of course if you come to the Cheesecake Factory you have to get some Cheesecake. Was a little disappointed they didn&#39;t have the Khalua available at that time, but no harm no foul. The wait time for the food wasn&#39;t long, but again, we came right when it opened. Your experience might be different, but I honestly cannot complain.

Waited 1 hour for a text.  Got to the front desk and they said they weren&#39;t ready and a table needed cleaned. 30 more minutes and still nothing .  40 minutes later and only after asking for the 3rd time if they forgot about me do I get seated.  Not sure I can even talk about the food now, but the seating staff is a hot mess.

My husband and I come here every time we are in Atlanta to get cheesecake. This is the first time we&#39;ve ever actually eaten here. It did not disappoint! The stuffed mushrooms were outstanding! Probably the best I have ever tasted! Cooked perfectly and full of flavor. I had the skinny lettuce chicken tacos Asian style. I could have drank the sauce, it was so good! My husband got the wings and said they were good too. Glad we decided to eat lunch here, can&#39;t wait to do it again!

A Cheesecake Factory is nothing original. But, between the savory food and creamy cheesecakes, it makes you crawling back every once in a while for more.<br><br>This location offers different seating options. Indoor seating and heated outdoor seating. This location is also very large, BUT there is almost always a wait. I cannot count on my fingers how many times we&#39;ve come to this location and we&#39;re told that we need to wait upwards an hour for a table and we just turned around and walked out. <br><br>It&#39;s also very loud and the indoor seating area is caotic. So, u suggest you sit outside of you can.<br><br>We really enjoyed our food though. And the portions are huge!!!!!

Well I was expecting a great lunch here. I ordered a Vegan Cobb salad. It came covered with black pepper. I know I&#39;m not a local to Atlanta but Who serves salad with black pepper all over It, usually they ask. I returned the salad and asked for no black pepper well they couldn&#39;t do that either. I&#39;m sure they just scraped off the black pepper and returned it as it was, there was less black pepper so I just move the stuff with black pepper on it to the side and did my best to enjoy the salad.  Then I found slimy endive, yikes!  The salad concept was great but the salad wasn&#39;t. Unfortunate lunch for me won&#39;t be back!

Despite some of the low reviews for this review, I will have to say that I thoroughly enjoyed this place very much after 2 visits. My bf first brought me here one year ago b/c we were in the mood for some dessert after our dinner. I&#39;ve never been to this establishment before despite it being a commonplace chain. We were seated in one place at first, but we wanted a different seating and got it cuz it wasn&#39;t so busy that late night so kudos to the waiter.<br><br>We told the server that we were only going to get dessert and he still gave us the complimentary bread with butter, which was really tasty and awesome.I actually wished I wanted more but had to hold back cuz I just had dinner and needed room for the cake that were going to order.<br>We got the Tiramisu Cheesecake and Lemon Raspberry Cream Cheesecake<br>(Raspberry-Vanilla Cake, Creamy Lemon Cheesecake, Raspberry Lady Fingers and Lemon Mousse)<br>We both enjoyed the Lemon Raspberry chzcake a lot more than the Tiramisu. The tiramisu wasn&#39;t bad, but I think we only found out that we preferred the sweet-citrusy taste over the coffee taste. <br><br>For my 2nd visit, we found out that it had moved to Lenox Mall, so of course it was extremely busy. We arrived around 7:15pm, got a ticket that said ETA 75-90 minutes (yikes! used the waiting time to explore the mall). They got our cell phone number to text, which was nice.<br><br>We got seated in the booth, ordered the  Stuffed Mushrooms for small plate and Chicken Bellagio to share. The stuffed mushrooms were cheezy good. My bf recommended the chicken bellagio to me cuz he had tried it before and this dish is FANTASTIC! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! We even took some chicken bellagio to go! Everything tasted great! Service was on the slower side, but to be expected.

I have been to Cheesecake Factory to dine twice earlier and my husband &amp; I were here last Sunday for dinner after almost a year. <br>What particularly impresses me about this place is: First, their menu is really extensive. They have so many options to choose from; from snacks,appetizers to entrees the range of dish and cuisine is commendable. Second, whatever dish corresponding to a cuisine that they offer, is true to it&#39;s flavor and toothsome.  <br>They also have a separate brunch menu. <br><br>AMBIANCE: <br>Beautiful decor with large sitting area. classy ambiance with lively energy as the place is usually packed on weekends!<br><br>FOOD:<br>They serve hot and fresh mini baguettes with butter spread as complementary starters. <br><br>Placed the following order for our dinner:<br>Appetizer: <br>1. Nashville hot chicken nuggets(~$10): juicy chicken nuggets, fried to perfect crispiness smothered in a delectable hot sauce and pickles. Loved it!<br>2: Chicken Potstickers(~$10): The potstickers were good but what stood out was the sauce! It&#39;s very delicious. <br><br>Main Dish:<br>3. Chicken Madeira(~$15): this is their most famous chicken dish which comes as perfectly cooked chicken breasts topped with mozzarella cheese and served with mashed potatoes, asparagus and mushrooms. Tastes good. Portion is huge<br>4. Jamaican black pepper shrimp &amp; chicken(~$19): this is such a wholesome meal. You could choose either shrimp or chicken or combination of both which I did. Shrimp and chicken pieces in a spicy black pepper sauce served with brown/white rice, black beans, fried plantains and pineapple salsa. Absolutely loved the spicy black pepper sauce and the fried plantains.<br>The portions of food here is huge. Every time I am here, I always have left overs to take away.<br>During my earlier visits, I have tried the stuffed mushrooms, crab cakes, shrimp scampi and chicken marsala; all of them being delicious!<br>Their Cheesecakes which they are famous and known widely for is classic and perfect! I have had Cheesecakes here(carry out) so many times that I cannot even  keep a count of it. <br><br>SERVICE:<br>Friendly staff, service is fast and efficient. It could get really busy on weekends so there could be long waiting time.<br><br>Overall, a great choice to dine when you are in mood for a  three course meal in a fancy yet casual atmosphere. Also a very good option to dine especially when you are not sure what cuisine you want to eat on a particular day, as they offer so many choices here. A dish/cuisine they offer might not be the best in the city but everything is tasty, high quality, true to its flavor and of huge portions. <br>If you are not in a mood to dine, then it&#39;s an ultimate place to have Cheesecakes as carry out from their take away counter. <br>Taking into account the dining experience here (and not exclusively  their Cheesecake which they are so famous for) I give it a 4/5.

Well first of all when i walked in everybody just looked at me like i was crazy , nobody greeted us . We finally sat down ... this worker walked by and snot was coming out of his nose .... which was disgusting . Then i told my waitress i have a food allergy , she was kind of nonchalant about it . The food was great actually , alcoholic drinks where over priced and tasted like water .. for this to be the &#34; Buckhead &#34; , area it was shitty . I won&#39;t be back .

This Cheesecake Factory is great, it doesn&#39;t deserve such a poor rating. Sure, occasionally they mess up, but most of the time it&#39;s great. The hamburgers and fries never fail to utterly impress me. For how busy they are, they are consistently good...and this is coming from a person who eats here a lot!

My only hang up was the wait. I think there was an event in town that day so I&#39;ll give them a pass this time. Food and service was great. I enjoyed my meal, my son ate every bit of his. My son enjoyed his strawberry cheesecake. My waiter and my son shared the same name Deondre. He was just as kind as my son. Very attentive and helpful. Ill be bringing my son back on a few weeks for his birthday.
This place is nice. Today my pork chops were over cooked but they did remake my order without any hassle.

A friend and i needed to energize ourselves before heading to a nail salon in the area and Cheesecake Factory provided the perfect lunch. We even decided to return after the salon for dessert! <br><br>The menu is extensive - I recommend checking it out online if you can before you go, unless you enjoy leisurely considering menu options when you&#39;re starving. i enjoyed my Caesar salad and my friend liked her baked chicken which i thnk was accompanied by quinoa and vegetables. The dessert we had later on was the highlight of the day, however. We both had the apple pie a la mode which came with the most diesel dollop of whipped cream on the planet! Each bite was euphoric. <br><br>Definitely recommend the CF for a casual dinner with friends or a date. Valet parking can be a bit of a zoo, especially when trying to exit, but it&#39;s worth it.

Usually a big fan of this place but last nights experience was not the best. I ordered the New York steak (MEDIUM WELL)  with mashed potatoes and grilled asparagus. Once it arrived at the table, the steak was very small and crispy burnt on the outer edges. Once I tasted a piece of the steak, it was very tough, had little seasoning and tasted burnt as well . However , I continued to eat the potatoes and asparagus and when my waiter came back I asked him for a new steak because it was burnt and I requested medium well. The waiter took my plate and returned to the kitchen. A few minutes later , the manager (His name is Will) approached my table and asked me if I requested for a new one, I said yes and he asked me for the reason. I told him the exact reason I told our waiter. He then continued to argue with me very loudly in front of everyone in our section of the restaurant  , telling me the steak was not burnt and that I had already eaten a lot of the steak (I only took one bite and the steak was very little in comparison to everybody else&#39;s). I told him I only took ONE bite and the steak was cut in HALF. He continued to argue with me before interrupting me every time I tried to speak. He then walked off in the middle of our conversation  and went back into the kitchen . It took so long for my second steak I just asked them to box it up to take home. (I was going to get dessert but after my bad experience I decided not to). Once I got home and started to eat my food , the asparagus was burnt completely black, and the steak was undercooked . I was very upset , especially after leaving a very nice tip for my waiter. I won&#39;t be returning .

Way too many tables for one sever. Took my girlfriend and I 2 hours to eat a burger. Never were asked for refills, never got a new drink. <br><br>Awful service and cold food. The poor guy was trying but had over 10 tables that I could count.

I&#39;ve been known to poo-poo chain restaurants, but I&#39;ll tell ya: lunch at the Cheesecake Factory today, was pretty good!<br><br>For $10.95 I got a combo -- the Renee something-or-other -- which included soup (a  delicious bowl of New England Clam chowder: very clammy, not much filler),  half a chicken salad sandwich, and a large portion of field greens (with homemade chunky blue cheese dressing.)  The gratis bread brought to the table was crusty, fresh and just the way I like it.<br><br>Despite post-Christmas crowds at Lenox Mall, at 12 noon there was no wait for lunch.  The restaurant is large, the seating comfortable and the wait-staff quick and efficient.

The food is standard, mostly bland and u had to search for fish thru the breading of the southern catfish. But my main problem with this one is service. It seems Cheesecake Factory in general has declined in quality of service or they just don&#39;t care who they hire or how they train them. The only one who actually smiled in this place was the hostess. She was lovely. Otherwise our waitress was non attentive and her attitude was not cool. <br><br>First, we had leftovers so wanted to pack the rest to go. She cuts me off and says &#34;well I don&#39;t know what u want so I&#39;ll just bring u out a couple boxes&#34;. And walked off rolling her eyes. Um ok... Then wanting to pay I had an online gift card so I take out my phone and before I even open my mouth or show her anything she says &#34;we don&#39;t do coupons here&#34;. Coupons?! Who said anything about coupons?! And mainly the whole time stomping around our table rolling her eyes. Wth is that about?? And when getting up to leave, keep in mind my mother needs a walker to get around, another server is behind her rolling her eyes like she&#39;s saying &#34;hurry up!&#34;.
