Let&#39;s see how u are thirty years from now and disabled u bitch. This is the worst and most rude place I&#39;ve been. <br><br>Anyway it would take a miracle for me to go back to any cheesecake factory restaurant. Not worth the aggravation.

Horrible service, dirty dishes! I came today, on a random Thursday afternoon and had a crazy wait time.. waitress was rude (forgot her name). I alerted her about the dishes being dirty (which was clearly noticeable) and she copped an attitude about it, grabbed the menus, and walked away instead of at least trying to resolve the issue by replacing them. Not to mention there was green stuff floating in my gf&#39;s water. Table was dirty, menu was dirty. We just decided to abruptly leave. It was just too much.

I hadn&#39;t wrote a review in a long time so I think nows the time! I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory 2 times now and they&#39;ve been pretty good so I went last night at like 8/9 PM with my grandparents because I was sleeping over for my birthday so we went so we went in to the hostess and she said it&#39;s about a 15 minute wait and we were ok. We waited by the way are sever was so nice! She got are order right! Which is amazing! So I ordered lemonade and my grandparents ordered wine ok so their were are orders I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich with fries my grandma ordered a turkey sandwich and my grandpa ordered sweet potato&#39;s I think with chicken. My grandpa didn&#39;t like his food he said it was cold or something. He did write a bad review too about that they don&#39;t have that much things on the menu so he asked for the manager than she came out and she did take it off the bill which was good. In my opinion my grandpa&#39;s experience wasn&#39;t the best. Mine was pretty good. By the way the server also gave me free ice cream for my birthday! And they even did the birthday song! So nice! The real question is I would probably not take my grandpa next time.

We arrived were seated immediately, however, it took about 20 minutes before someone waited on us. At least 6 waiters/waitresses walked by our table on the patio 3 or more times avoiding eye contact or any communication at all. Once the waitress (Queen)came over to our table she explained, it was not her table but she would take our order.  We ordered 2 pizzas, a lettuce wrap, steak Diane and lasagna. All the food arrived except 1 pizza which Queen said would take 2 minutes ( it took 20 minutes), and the steak Diane was cold. Everything else I must say, wasn&#39;t bad. I requested to speak with the manager Rick who Queen said she informed him of our concerns and he walked by our table 3 times with his head high and didn&#39;t say a word. The table across from us also requested to speak with him, the lady tapped on his hand, he said he would return and never did. He had no plans on addressing our concerns and at one point yelled across room &#34;WHAT&#34;. I was afraid to talk with him so I asked to speak with another manager.  Queen was able to get another manager to talk with us who was very nice, Ryan listened to our concerns and apologized but by then the damage was done. My advice, AVOID THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY at LENOX MALL. THE SERVICE SUCKS!!!!!!!

-1 star. Never again. I ordered a 6 inch cheesecake for my mom ( I usually avoid this place like the plague) at the counter &amp; was told it was &#34;severely chilled&#34; a/k/a frozen so it would take 15-20 min. After 30 minutes, I inquired &amp; was told someone was pulling it. At 45 min, I checked again. Other people who ordered after me got theirs before me. Finally I got it after 50 minutes! I got home &amp; it was still 100% frozen (like their other pre-made chain food). Why the heck make me wait almost an hour just to go up to the freezer &amp; pull out a frozen cheesecake. When I discovered this at home I called to complain &amp; was told the reason was miscommunication, they were busy, they shouldn&#39;t have told me it was going to be 15 minutes, etc....  Terrible service! Low quality food. Long lines. Overpriced. Just avoid this place. You&#39;ll have a better experience getting a cheesecake at Kroger.

This is, by far, the worst Cheesecake Factory that I have ever been to. From the hostesses, to the servers, the attitude was clearly their best attribute. So if you want to eat dinner where no one smiles and they tend to forget about you, please, eat here. That&#39;s clearly the only thing they&#39;re good at.<br><br>Update: They responded with a general response. Dont waste your money here. They clearly don&#39;t care.
overpriced but I can see why, the food is always presented beautifully and the atmosphere is warm and friendly and the staff is always nice.

This Cheesecake Factory changed my mind for the better about the Cheesecake Factory restaurant chain. <br>I&#39;ve never been to a Cheesecake Factory in my life until I moved to Atlanta, the thought of the immense menu made me question how quality the dishes must be....but if Drake loves it so much that he&#39;ll write a song about it...there&#39;s no way I&#39;m going to miss out on trying it out, so I went appropriately to the one attached to Lenox mall. <br><br>I&#39;ve frequented this particular cheese cake at least 6 times for both take out and dine in. <br>The staff is ALWAYS friendly, no matter how busy it is, because it does get very busy on weekends (so keep that in mind). <br>The food has always been delicious, I usually get the &#34;grilled steak medallions&#34; off of the &#34;skinny&#34; menu.....trust me, they don&#39;t taste skinny the dish taste amazing! <br>And obviously desert....NEVER disappoints, I usually get the Reese&#39;s Cheesecake...not to be confused with the Adams peanut butter cheese cake...I personally this the Reese&#39;s Cheesecake is better! <br>An issue I have with this particular restaurant is that the line between people picking up food-ordering strictly cheesecake/dessert - and people waiting to be seated verses waiting to put their names in for a table gets VERY compacted and confusing in regards to your place in line and where you have to be to get what.

I&#39;m an avid &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34; consumer, and the experience at this location was no different. My wait on a Sunday morning was approximately 15 minutes, but the actual wait was a little less than that. After getting seated, our server quickly came by, got our drink orders, and promptly brought out our beverages/bread. The cobb salad was more abundant than the other locations I usually go to. Lastly, our waitress &#34;LaToya&#34; was spot on with all aspects.<br><br>Main point = I still love Cheesecake Factory.
Till sitting down seat took 30min. Till getting ordered food more than 30min. So disappointed. The taste of food is not so good.

I will never visit this place again. I often go to Cheesecake and have been to this location once before. I wasn&#39;t impressed with the service last time but ultimately could not complain either. Last night I flew in from a 10 hour flight so I was closer to the restaurant and decided to dine there. I came around 10:30 PM and my husband I were seated right away.. Our server was tending to the table next to us and spilled ketchup on himself. He walked away upset. We felt bad for him and sat there for 10 min (understanding) that he was taking care of his stained shirt. Someone else came up to us and said our waiter needed help so she is going to take our drink order.. We were hungry so we ordered the Avacado rolls, Mushroom Soup and Salads for starters with 2 waters and 1 cup of coffee. We told her we knew what we wanted for our dinner and she took that order as well. Chicken Madeira was what we asked for. She left and about 5 -10 min later ANOTHER woman came and said she is going to be our SERVER now. We said ok thank you, and she walked away. She didn&#39;t ask us about our food and we didn&#39;t think to ask since it was already ordered with the previous person that walked up to our table. Another 10 minutes passed and a gentleman came and introduced himself as OUR WAITER and told us that they were out of the Mushroom soup and out of the Avacado rolls. By this time I was very annoyed because he was the 4th person that walked up to our table AND I hadn&#39;t even received the cup of coffee I ordered! He said sorry, I told him bring us our salads and how much longer for the food? He went to go check, came back with salads and said no order for dinner was put in and the kitchen was closed. We asked for the manager who simply said I&#39;m sorry about the situation.Told us the bill was not going to be given to us.. I was COMPLETELY taken back. He took care of a bill that consisted of water, coffee, and 2 house salads. He not once offered a credit, offered a piece of cheesecake NOTHING. He really didn&#39;t show any concern for the way we were treated. I will NEVER go back to this location again.

The new restaurant in Lenox Mall is very impressive and large. My sister and I came here for dinner and the wait wasn&#39;t too long at all. <br>We were seated next to a large group and no server came to great us because they were too busy openly praying with the table next to us. That was an uncomfortable situation because praying is fine, I don&#39;t mind that of course but to stop your service and pray with a table for a long period of time was awkward. <br>Our server finally came to our table and took our orders without writing it down so she had to come back and ask us what we wanted..... Annoying. <br>The food here is not great it&#39;s very bleh and meh and average. I would much rather not eat here again. I will pass.

Do not eat here for lunch during the week. Long wait to get a table. Misquoted wait times. Hostess stand not organized.<br><br>Decided to have lunch hear on a weekday and realized it was not a good idea early in. The wait time to sit down is unacceptable for lunch and the food service was slow. We waited about 30 mins after ordering for our food to come out.<br><br>I did like our server but outside of that I could of went without that experience.

If I could rate this place in NEGATIVE stars i would. The service in this buisiness there was indescribably ridiculous. Our server taked us into going somewhere else and lied saying the fryer was down WHEN IT REALLY WAS NOT . Not sure if our server was racist or had a hidden agenda but it was extremely unprofessional and hurtful to ruin one of my loved ones birthdays. When I tried to reach the store to voice my concern they continuously hung up on me. Most horrific buisness and Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to, would not go back in there if it was the last place on earth. Don&#39;t know how this buisness is still open.

The cheese cake factory was so good ! I had the honey truffle chicken &amp; it was so bomb ! But I wish it was a lil more honey on the chicken to balance out the taste . I also had another problem while we going to sit at our table it was a roach crawling on our seat that was a big turn off ! But other than that good was delicious

Use to be my favorite place to celebrate an special moment. Not anymore. The wait even at 9 pm at night was insane. We saw empty tables with plates sitting on them for a long time. The service is ridiculous. The hostess seemed to hate her job. Our waitress was awful!! We were celebrating two birthdays and said that multiply times. No acknowledgment or anything! Kids were disappointed that no one came to sing at the table when other tables did! Even tables where they ordered no dessert. They sang to them over a candle lit ice cream bowl. She didn&#39;t refill the cups, she didn&#39;t ask if food was ok? She never came back til the end to ask if we wanted dessert? The food has gone way down. I could have went in mall and got better food. Will not return , which is a shame bc it use to be favorite restaurant.
The appetizers were tasty.  We ordered chicken enchiladas and another sandwich.  Nothing stood out as fantastic.  Very very crowded.  Located near Macy&#39;s at Lenox Square.

Tried it again just to see if service was any better and was still disappointed. The staff is now knowledgeable about the things on the menu, the food came out wrong, lukewarm and the list goes on... I will pass.

By far the worst service at a restaurant in a long while. We arrived at 5. 30min wait. Seems excessive for 5p, but okay it&#39;s Labor Day. We should&#39;ve left then. Long story short--we sit, order immediately bc we&#39;re pressed for time, wait and wait and wait wo anything but water and bread. After over an hour, many complaints, and little response, we left having received only half our order (our whole order was small, primarily apps). Apparently the kitchen was very backed up. Okay sure, but waitress was completely overwhelmed, disappearing completely, manager was only mildly helpful; and food barely came out at all. We left irritated and got food somewhere else. I know chzcake factory isn&#39;t known for its quick service, but this experience was beyond bad. One would think when u finally track down the manager and say hey it&#39;s been an hour, and we received not a single app, there would be a quickness to service, but nope, even at that pt we were still waiting and left wo receiving everything we ordered.  Steer clear.
Really haven&#39;t been sleeping well since the crispy crab wontons were taken off the menu... when will they be back? :(

I have been here several times and the food is always delicious. They serve complimentary warm bread once you are seated that is very yummy. The Tex Mex egg roll appetizer was warm and accompanied by an avocado sauce that goes perfectly with it. For my entree I ordered the fresh basil and tomato flatbread which was pretty good. I personally needed a sauce with it so my waitress recommended the creamy marinara which made it much better. The only complaint I have is that the menu is entirely too long so it&#39;s difficult to narrow down the options. My server Amy was amazing and made sure we were satisfied throughout the entire dinner. Overall, the experience was pretty good.
Beautiful atmosphere. Prompt service. Never disappoints!! The heated patio is a definite this time of year!!

Nice restaurant. Minimal wait time to get a table (at about 11:20 am). The waiter threw me off because he was a MALE waiter named, SAMANTHA. The food was good, but a little pricey. Wife and I had lunch and spent $60 for lunch. Not cool. Overall, the service and experience was nice, but on the pricey side. I would go back, but not often.

This was my first time visiting the Cheesecake Factory and the service was absolutely horrible , me and my family waited 2 hours just to get bread and it was extremely hard , our waiter failed to check on us in a timely fashion. I will not be coming back to this location anytime soon.‍
We ordered two different types of Cheesecake today.  Both were &#34;frozen&#34; and needed to be thawed out.  Service started out good but became poor quickly.<br><br>Overrated!!

I had two parts to my stay, took a while to get a waiter to me but when I did, she did great.  My meal came out pretty quick but when my daughter and wife came to eat after shopping, there meals arrived cold and the eggs were terrible.

I&#39;ve eaten at the cheesecake factory several times, and tonight was by far the worse experience. Staying at the Whitley and wanted a bite around 10pm so I walked across the street to the Cheesecake factory. I came in alone, waited about 5 mins for a seat at the bar, and was greeted almost immediately. Good start. After waiting about 2 minutes ordered a beer and some food. Now, I&#39;ve been in the food and beverage industry many years myself, so I know people get busy, especially bartenders. She put my orders in, printed out my receipt, and did everything else but make my drink, including pick up her cell phone and return a FEW messages. Still, not tripping, it could be an emergency, but then she emptied the dishwasher and started bussing empty seats. &#34;Excuse me, do you think I could get that Sweetwater anytime soon??&#34; I totally forgot she says with a laugh, as if I thought the situation was funny. I will say the food came out promptly, but after I finished my card say in that shot glass for at least 15 minutes. She was clearly more worried with getting her closing duties done than servicing her customers. Smh. I stopped and let the manager know about the service, and got in line to buy some cheesecake to go. He pauses, asked if I was buying some cheesecake to go, I replied yes, he walked away and never returned. I wanted some cheesecake, I didn&#39;t mind paying for it, but I didn&#39;t see the point in asking me if I was buying cheesecake to go if he wasn&#39;t taking care of it. I&#39;ll be at the Whitley for three more days, but I will not be returning here.<br>Side note, the gentleman working with her seemed very attentive, somehow I got the wrong bartender.

It is hard to state that anything can be &#34;bad&#34; here.  The menu is HUGE, the selection is MASSIVE, and the food tastes GOOD.  I can definitely tell that they changed some of the salads around, but that is ok.  Our server was nice and quick to come out with drinks, bread, and the salads.  I had the Chicken Salad that had an Asian flavor to it.  It was just ok.  I expected more of a peanut style dressing, but it was more salty than anything else.  My sister ordered the tacos which were just so so.  Then again, why order tacos at a non-Mexican restaurant?!?!  <br><br>Overall, you get a lot for your money and at lunch time the lunch portions are huge!

Okay several things. We were told the wait was gonna be 45- an hour.. k? We had to wait for TWO HOURS.. oh it gets better, the manager came over to talk to us and one of the WAITRESSES, (you read that right) THE FREAKING WAITRESS had the audacity to get rude! She asked us to move .. right? MOVE! That was like the straw that broke the camels back.. i snapped. Can&#39;t lie. so once we FINALLY got seated our party sat at 3 separate tables. Like what? K, and no shade to our waitress bc she was great! Like she was ON POINT! She was literally the only good part about the night. But once the food got here the food the kids.. KIDS quesadilla had freaking jalapeños in it. Since when does a kids meal come with jalapeños? It&#39;s a KIDS meal. Gahhhhh. This was just an annoying ass night. Cheesecake Factory slacked times 100. And on a scale of 1-10, they literally get a zero! No &#34;a&#39;s&#34; for effort. They can&#39;t collect 200 for passing &#34;go&#34;.. like they just need to start again tomorrow.. of just fire the whole staff &amp; hire my family.. bc literally we could have done a better job tonight(&amp; we&#39;ve never worked in a restaurant setting before).

I usually love the cheesecake factory but this location wasnt impressive. The wait was long and when they called our name they told us the hostess would then help us. She walked away while we stood there confused as what to do. They were extremely busy so this was understandable but they were out of bread and we were hungry from the long wait. The three of us all got pasta dishes and that as well took an extremely long time. The food was good, but not worth the time we spent waiting at every step.

You can never go wrong with Cheesecake Factory or can you?? The wait was supposed to be for 40 min for a table of two during peak hours but since we asked to sit outside or first available during a hot day it really only was 10 minutes. Kudos! <br><br>Now here&#39;s my problem. My friend and I split the bill and a couple days later I checked the balance and someone apparently decided my 20% tip wasn&#39;t enough and added an extra $2 and some change on my bill and also on my friends! Check back with your accounts after it fully processes to make sure this doesn&#39;t happen. Also I called and spoke with a manager who said this would be resolved in 3-5 business days and well... It never was... Thanks for making me do all the dirty work of calling my bank and refusing the charges when they should have resolved the issue in the first place.

Very good, I went with a friend to celebrate my birthday week. The pina colada was magnificent and my meal was delicious as well. I normally get the Lemonchello cheesecake but decided to get the seasonal pumpkin pecan. Had to get my Avocado egg rolls but I think 11.95 is a bit much, I remember when it used to be 8.95.

Cheesecake Factory has always been one of my favorite places to go. The food is great, amazing portions, variety of desserts and good ambiance for causal dinner or date night. <br><br>However, this time was very disappointing. (We went on Tuesday)<br>It has been months since I have gone, so I had to satisfy my craving. <br>Since it was my day off, I had called ahead to ask them about their cork fee because I wanted to relax, drink some wine, and have dinner. I was really happy and excited with how cheap the cork fee is! ($10)<br>So I chilled two bottles of white to have with apps and dinner and to just relax and hang out. <br><br>We got seated near the kitchen corner and so it took a while for our server to come to us. Took like 15 mins to get water and order our app and the Thai Lettuce Wrap took forever to come out. At least 30 mins!<br>The thing that really blew my mind was the &#34;wine chiller&#34;. So we asked our server to keep one of the bottles cold and she was nice to take it with her. We asked her if she had a bucket of ice or something we can have to chill the wine we were about to drink. She said yes and that she would bring us a bucket. <br><br>She brings the marble wine chiller but it was warm. So my bf asked if they had a cold one and she said that they don&#39;t keep it chilled. This blew my mind, why would you not store these in the fridge? Or maybe let the customer know that they dont have any way to keep the white wine cold. Then I may not have paid the cork fee and just ordered cocktails or wine on their list. <br>So my bf and I had to put ice in the first few glasses of our wine and ask the server to bring us ice. She first only put like 5 ice pieces in the bucket! Are you kidding? So we dumped our ice waters into the bucket and it just was very inconvenient and a waste. <br>Then we asked for the other bottle, hoping to enjoy this one cold. But it wasn&#39;t cold! So I don&#39;t know where she placed the bottle for over 45 mins... so then we had to dump out the water in the bucket, ask for more ice, and wait another 30 mins til the bottle got someone chilled. <br><br>The food on the other hand, was amazing! We both ordered a pasta dish and a key lime cheesecake. This was the only thing that got me through the night. Good thing the food is still rememberable. <br>It was just such a shame that they dropped the ball on this. <br>Hopefully someone will catch it, especially before the weather gets hot.

The food was really good and fresh! I really enjoyed my Cheese Stuffed Burger. The atmosphere was very clean and eligibility put together. Of course the best part was the cheesecake. I had the classic cheesecake, it was wonderful!

I sat at the bar and the service was fantastic as were the mixed drinks. Unfortunately the food was very disappointing.  I had the Louisiana Chicken Pasta which the chicken was over cooked and dry.  The pasta sauce was watery and not very tasty. Two stars on the food, four stars on everything else.

Went for dinner with the family on a Friday night around 8:00p and there was a 39 minute wait. It was a little confusing as to where we needed to sign in but once we found the right line they took our number and texted when the table was ready. It actually only took 20 minutes. <br><br>Our waiter Kevin was the bomb dot com! Very attentive and thorough. Good communication with us all night and sent us home with a loaf of that amazing bread! <br><br>Food was great. My dad is obsessed with the calamari especially since he&#39;s been looking for some good calamari lately. I had the Greek Salad and Feta/Sausage Flatbread which is my go-to. My stepmom had the jambalaya pasta and it was off the hook! Huge portions so be ready!!

If I could give it a 0 I would. Our server Mirtha G was impossibly slow. I mean impossibly. I went here last night for drinks and dinner with a friend. Never received our bread, one app was delicious the second was horrible. Mirtha would have known had she come back to the table and ask! We weren&#39;t going to make a deal out of it instead order an entree to share, except by the time she did come around we&#39;d been waiting so long that we decided to just get the check and have dinner somewhere else. Now I know Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t known for their award winning customer service but this one is far worse than any I&#39;ve been to. I mean it was a Thursday night, it was slow in comparison to their weekends, SLOW! There was no reason for tables all around ours to be getting refills and checks in timely manner but not ours. Smh. Last night my friend and I swore off Cheesecake Factory forever.

The only reason this place gets 2 is because I have had some pretty nice servers. Everything else is garbage. The service from management is a joke. Instead of just listening and fixing the problem?he wants to cut me off and tell me why they cant do a simple request. Request: please dont burn the chips on my nachos. Simple enough. Among that the food is hardly consistent, from the flavor to appearance to price. We wont be coming here for a LONG time. Sucks for them because we eat out at least 4 times a week.

Don&#39;t try to take a large party here. They refused to do call ahead seating they refused and said we have to be present. Once we arrived the wait rime went from 45 mins to 3-4 hrs.  Sorry not going to wait that long the food is not that good and the cheesecake is frozen. Not worth it!!!!

Had the lasagna marinara and it was by far the best lasgna I&#39;ve had. The pasta sheets had spinach in them and the sauce was neither too tangy nor bland. I am a fan of their complimentary breads, which was served fresh out of the oven. The service was well-organised and pleasant. The mango key lime cheesecake was a perfect finish to the delicious meal. Would definitely go back!
This is one of the best Cheesecake Factory restaurants I have been to. Food and service is always great. Only down side is there is always a long wait.

Arrived today at the Cheesecake Factory and was told there was an hour wait. After an hour of waiting I was told another 20 mins. After almost two hours of waiting I asked for the manger as I wanted to make a complaint to corporate and make him aware. I was greeted with his back and he failed to acknowledge me. I asked him for his name about 4 times and he finally turned around and said Michael. Who knows if that was his name but he had the &#34;PRINCE&#34; look. My family and I were tired of waiting and left. The customer service was horrible!

I come to this location quite often, because I love the outside seating. The young lady that served me was exceptional, and the food never disappoints. Parking is never an issue, since it is outside of the mall. I sat outside for a while just watching people pass, and was left undisturbed. This is why I love coming to this location. It&#39;s a great spot for a Friday afternoon cocktail.

So we came  to lunch and we were brought. To are table really fast  l thought it would take a long time because I saw a review for cheese cake factory. and people said it was a long wait and I was like I thought it would take long but it did not:) and omg the fries were so good! And  I also came with my mom and brother and they loved it to. The waiter even  put my mom&#39;s tea in the trash when she was done with it. I thought it was so nice! And sweet thing to do we had a good lunch we will come back!!!!

Cheesecake Factory is one of our favorites. The new location at Lenox is really nice. The decor is appealing and the wait staff is very competent and attentive. The bread is so good to start with. I had the teriyaki chicken and my husband has the chicken and biscuits. Both were delicious and had enough to take home for lunch. Then there was dessert. OMG- the cheesecake variety choices. Not a bad one in the bunch!  We shared the white chocolate macadamia nut cheesecake. Delicious!  We will be back.

Very horrible experience.... From the servers to management. It started bad and ended bad. We were told by 3 servers that the server for our table would be with us for 30 min. Bread was brought to our table with no butter. The table that sat next to us after us got all of their  food before us and in a timely manner. When we finally got a server our glasses stayed empty as if we didn&#39;t need a refill. The manager looked at us when we complained like we were wrong to complain, my food came out undercooked and by that time I was over it. The manager had the nerve to come back to the table after she was told that I didn&#39;t want my food to ask what&#39;s wrong now..... Oh we were also told that we shouldn&#39;t have been seated in that section because the server in that area was really busy with a big party... I chose this spot over Mimi&#39;s I will never make that mistake again nor will I ever eat at CF.

So anyone who knows me knows that I love Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve been to every location in Atlanta multiple times and others in different cities. Yes, I&#39;m a fan and have never had a bad experience at any of them (although I recognize that others may have). <br><br>That said, I&#39;ve never reviewed this restaurant because... well I&#39;m not really sure. I guess there are so many reviews out there and it is a chain restaurant so what you get is pretty standard wherever you so. <br><br>Nevertheless, I had for the first time their turkey burger from the skinnylicious menu and it was so good. It was cooked perfectly, seasoned well and just so good. On top of that the waiter on this particular visit was exceptional. I wish I remembered his name. Oh well... if you&#39;re in the lenox area it&#39;s definitely worth a visit!
Worst cheese cake I have ever been too. Had to send back my calamari because It was all breading and not cooked. Main dish came out cold and didn&#39;t taste right
Great place to hangout with friends and enjoy some good dessert. The was good but could have been better.

Worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to!!<br>1.5hr wait, all the food was cold and greasy.<br>They were out of maybe 5 items on the menu, and after speaking with the manager he said sorry nothing they can do about it!<br><br>*Lenox Mall Cheesecake Factory location*

Average food. Great cheesecake. I only came here for the cheesecake. There wasn&#39;t a wait when we arrived. Our waitress was okay, refills took awhile and took a long time to get change for our bill. We started off with an egg roll sampler. It came with A Variety of Egg rolls with Avocado, Tex Mex, Crispy Cuban and Firecracker Salmon. Some was a hit some was a miss. They give you three different sauce to dip as well. It was okay but I will not order it again. We ordered lunch portions. I order the Louisiana chicken pasta. It is Parmesan Crusted Chicken Served Over Pasta with Mushrooms, Peppers and Onions in a Spicy New Orleans Sauce. I thought the chicken was too plain with no dipping sauce. My boyfriend ordered the famous factory meatloaf. It is Served with Mashed Potatoes, Mushroom Gravy, Grilled Onions and Corn Succotash. He thought it was mediocre. Nothing too fancy. I thought if they didn&#39;t have so many items on their menu the food would taste better. We finished off with a white chocolate raspberry cheesecake. It was delicious! My favorite part of the meal.

New location. Spacious, clean, well-staffed (when I went). Your standard Cheesecake Factory fare, except .. GASP .. no Thai Chicken Pasta. :( <br><br>My heart was broken by the lack of my favorite lunch item, but my server suggested the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp, which was awesome. In fact, you could hold the shrimp and hold the chicken and just give me the sauce over rice and I&#39;d be happy. Especially with the wheat bread to dip in it. Yum.
One of the most favorite restaurant in Atlanta. I like their seafood plates like Salmon and shrimp. The cheesecake is wonderful with amazing varieties.

The service here kind of sucks. That alone docked the review down to two stars. We stood in front of the bakery/cheesecake display for a long time, there were no other customers, and no one offered assistance to see if we wanted to buy anything, so they lost our business there. In addition, when we went to get seated at the front reception area, we weren&#39;t acknowledged for at least 10 minutes, and there was nobody else waiting for service! When they finally took our names, there wasn&#39;t even a wait to be seated, so I really wonder what kept them from just looking at us and saying, &#34;I&#39;ll be with you in a moment.&#34; It was truly frustrating, especially because we were there to have a nice dining experience. <br><br>The only thing that saved this review from going down to a one-star experience was the food. The food was really good. My boyfriend and I both ordered the chipotle chicken pasta with an appetizer of the buffalo blasts, and we were impressed. I think the price of the food, although a bit pricey, was comparable to the quality of food served. We will definitely visit the Cheesecake Factory again, but we won&#39;t ever go back to this location.

Uhhh..... A 4 hour dinning experience and it wasn&#39;t due to eating 4 hours worth of food. I called beforehand to see the wait time. I didn&#39;t mind the wait, since it was a birthday celebration. We arrived and received our ticket. An hour passes by and I decide to go in and check. I was told by a staff member that our seats would be ready in 20 minutes. When I went back in to check a second time, I was told by a different staff member that we would seated by the time that appeared on my ticket I found this situation in itself to be misleading.  After waiting for almost two hours, we were finally seated. Our waiter was impatient when It came to us ordering our food.  Another table was served they arrived after us and within in 15 minutes, they received their food before us. After waiting for 20 minutes, our food arrived and it was cold and undercooked. The cook staff seem to be in a hurry when preparing food. Management wasn&#39;t helpful with situation. Spending 4 hours in a restaurant to receive bad service, we weren&#39;t pleased with the service that was given.

I went here on a Sunday after church services which is a very busy day for the Cheesecake Factory. BUT one of the waiters near the bar said that the high top tables were first come first serve. So, we were able to be seated quickly! My boyfriend and I split the Chicken Madera and it was delicious. The waiter recommended it as a popular dish. When you see the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s menu for the first time, it can be super overwhelming because there is SO many dishes. We definitely tried the Cheesecake. I got the s&#39;mores flavor and it was great! It had a roasted marshmallow on top and all! Great display and flavor of food! The prices are okay for the type of restaurant but the food portions are HUGE I definitely recommend sharing a dish if you&#39;re with a family or close friend.

Only good thing was even thought it was raining we did the out side seating so didn&#39;t have to wait forever. And my mango key lime cheesecake was tasty. Service was terrible. Never came back to ask if we need refills or anything else to drink. One of the party ordered a cup of coffee which she never received. I had the chicken pot pie with the puff pastry. Well the puff pastry looked good but the food was cold so I sent it back. All they did was stick it in microwave which made pastry rubbery. Ruined the whole dish. Should have just gone by the name and had the cheesecake only.

Let&#39;s start with the positive the location it&#39;s great if your looking for a nice place to have drinks after shopping with friends... that&#39;s where it stops just dined here Saturday the 5th. We waited about 45 minutes for a table (no problem it&#39;s a busy Saturday and the sun had finally come out) we were finally seated ordered our food and the order came out incorrect. I didn&#39;t want to send it back as to knowing they were busy but hey it&#39;s my money. Let server know steak was tough and cooked well when I wanted medium. She took entire plate before I could finish speaking came back 5 minutes later with the shrimp and mashed potatoes crammed on a small plate.I waited the first 10 minutes no issues another 10 pass still no food. My guest finished their meals and I&#39;m still waiting 30 minutes or more I asked for a manager(he already had an attitude before coming to table) asked what&#39;s issue advised my steak wasn&#39;t prepared medium but well done and I&#39;ve been waiting a long time for my food.  He asked do you still want it... ummm NO really sir would you after waiting this long... I won&#39;t be returning to this location.... it&#39;s more of a seen be seen instead of good customer service.. food was subpar on this occasion.

We usually love Cheescake Factory despite the long wait, but I don&#39;t know how this location is in business! I called ahead to ask if they had a new menu item and they said they did and this was the reason we went to the restaurant. <br><br>So, we drive 30 min there, wait 90 min, are seated and then at least 20 min go by with no bread. We ask for the bread and the waitress brought bread and butter but no silverware.  <br><br>We ordered the new menu item we had called about (the Impossible Burger, the only reason we went to this location) and then about 15 min later are told that they can&#39;t be served. I explained that I called ahead to inquire specifically if we could order that item and the manager came out to say sorry, it would only be available around dinner time (it was about 4pm). If the Impossible Foods company is advertising that their burger is available here, Cheesecake Factory needs to make sure they do indeed have the burger available for their patrons. The manager himself then finally gave us silverware (for the bread and butter).<br><br>So, we ordered 2 kids pastas which arrived with random pieces of spaghetti in with the bow tie pasta. I ordered the vegan cobb salad, which is awesome at the Perimeter mall location, but it was served with random chunks of rice, much smaller than the other location, and in general it just was not good. It seemed like the kids pasta and my salad were just thrown together with random ingredients on hand in the kitchen. I have ordered this salad at other locations and it has always been delicious. My husband ordered the sesame chicken (which he almost always gets at Cheescake factory) and it was also not good, we ended up taking it home and giving it to the dog.<br><br>The manager did take 25% off our bill for not having the burgers. However, the experience was awful!! Terrible service and in general they just did not seem to know what they are doing. We will never return to this location! If we eat at Lenox it will be at True Food Kitchen, if we want impossible burgers it will be at Grindhouse killer burgers on Piedmont and if we want Cheesecake factory we will go to Perimeter.
I would give zero stars but that&#39;s not an option ! Horrible service !! Horrible manager !! Cold and dried out food !!! Will not be coming to this location again.
Delicious as always, but our waitress Peaches was awesome &amp; on point!!! Our drinks were never empty, she was fast &amp; nice. HAPPY 2018!

Very disappointed. This is by far my favorite place eat but the service has severely gone downhill. The hostess told me it would only take 20 mins and it took 55 minutes before I was able to grab myself a table at the first come first serve bar seating. 10 minutes after I seated myself I was finally sent a text message saying they would seat me. Disappointing to say the least.
Consistent food. Great service. Positive dining experience. Kayla was our server and she was great. 5 stars.

I thought that going to the prime location in Buckhead would promise a great evening. However, I was completely wrong. Even though we were seated outside rather quickly for a Saturday night, they didn&#39;t have the heaters on in December. I know Georgia weather is crazy, but come on. <br><br>It was my wife&#39;s birthday and I had hoped she would enjoy herself. The drinks took forever to get to the table. The waitress seemed attentive at first, but that soon changed. I understand that they can get busy, but that shouldn&#39;t affect the service as much as it did. I even had to flag down her down when my wife had an issue with the horrible excuse for &#34;mashed potatoes&#34; she received when the food finally did come out. <br><br>My wife loves cheesecake to death and didn&#39;t even feel like ordering a slice on her birthday. Enough said.

Oh, Cheesecake Factory, how I so want to love you more! I always crave their strawberry martinis and their margarita pizza, but when the bill comes, I always regret it! Lol! It&#39;s seems their prices are getting higher to me. Otherwise, I&#39;m ordering 1 too many strawberry martinis! Now that I&#39;ve learned how to make them, I might just be taking the party to the house!

I came in to purchase a red velvet cheese cake  the server Denise I&#39;m going to up load a picture you really have to call out people who gives you horrible service put a melted cheese cake in the bag I asked her can she please swap out the cheese cake I refuse to take it it was melted and smashed in the box she told me No she can&#39;t change it I asked her why she says she&#39;s busy and it would take to long I told her I wasn&#39;t accepting it she told me if I don&#39;t wanna take the cheese cake I can leave her establishment I asked her name she said Denies and was very rude. Cheesecake factory is one of my favorite places to eat but the rude server  has no idea of customer service I don&#39;t think I would patronize this particular store horrible horrible experience and at the end of it all I didn&#39;t get a cheesecake something needs to be done about rude employees

Came in yesterday for my birthday dinner with my husband. Had a server who seemed not very friendly didn&#39;t introduce her self to us and never once asked us if we enjoyed our meal she would refill our drinks and then disappear for a long time. My fries were hard and didn&#39;t look fresh so I told her if I could get some fresh fries. She didn&#39;t apologize about the fries just disappeared again and brought much better looking fries back but just dropped them off at the table without saying a word. Also I politely told her in the beginning it was my birthday and a got a very dry low reply &#34;oh happy birthday&#34; lol she didn&#39;t say anything about getting me a birthday dessert at the end or anything because usually when you tell your server that at a popular chain restaurant they give you free dessert and have their coworkers sing happy birthday. My husband brought it up towards the end again and he asked do you guys do that and her response &#34;No sir&#34; again very dry response. Lol she said we can do that if you buy a dessert. Wow not sure if we just got a bad server but that seemed strange to me I&#39;m actually going to call today to ask to see if she was lying. My hubby and I love the Cheesecake Factory and usually get great food and service, but not sure if we would come back to this location. The servers need to be taught about customer service skills and etiquette.

I LOVE the Cheesecake Factory. This review is solely for the curbside to go service. As I sit in my car typing this review; 30 minutes have passed since I placed my order. All I order was a cheesecake nothing they have to prepare.<br><br>As the &#34;duke&#34; for this location,I can attest to this bring a common occurrence. Sometimes I just go inside to get my items and leave. (Completely negating the convenience of curbside to go service)<br><br>Also, there are 5 spots reserved for curbside to go service. People will park their cars here and go into the mall shopping. No enforcement at all. This location should do away with this service as they do such a poor job coordinating it.
Excellent food and service. I had a burger and fries and it was delicious. The atmosphere was upbeat and warm.

I have frequented the Cheesecake Factory in Lenox and Perimeter Mall.  For the most part, I enjoyed my service. However this last visit to the Lenox location was HORRIBLE.  My family of six had our family brunch.  We ordered our food and only 4 of us got our food. We thought that the 2 orders would come out.  It turns out one of the meals was not even made, and the other was just sitting on the counter waiting to be delivered to our table. So my brother waited 20 minutes after we had all gotten our food. My sister had to wait an additional 30-40 minutes!!!!  This there our whole day off, and we were late for our next event!!<br><br>The manager (whichever manager that is present on Sunday afternoon) was not very sympathetic.  He had the audacity to only offer to give us a single slice of free cheesecake as if that would fix everything. Its so sad because he relayed this message through the wait staff instead of coming out to speak to us.  So we immediately asked to speak to the manager. He offered to take one of the late meals off the ticket and give us two slices of cheesecake. But he did so rather unapologetic about the inconvenience that was caused and was rather defensive.  <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory Lenox location absolutely just lost 6 customers.  We&#39;ll take our money where management demonstrates better customer service and treats their patrons like they actually want their return business

I have eaten at The Cheesecake Factory and this specific location over the past few years and have received nothing less than exceptional customer service when I dine at any Cheesecake Factory location. However tonight I arrived at 8:30 pm with two of my friends and had a completely different experience. We were originally seated in the bar area and then decided to switch to a booth to be seated more comfortably. There was a verbal communication made between our original server and the host to transfer our order to the new table. We tipped the original server before being reseated for being so accommodating. 30 minutes later we started to wonder why our food had not yet come to our new table. We asked our new server and he stated he would check to see. One of my friends later received her food but my other male friend and I had not. At 9:35 pm we still had not received the rest of our food and was told by our new server he was going to find out what happened and he would get a manager. The manager then comes to the table with our food 1 1/2 hours later with no explanation of what happened or if we even still wanted our food. From his point of view he assumed that as long as we got our food and it was hot nothing else mattered. He expressed no concern for our time, was unapologetic and offered no accommodations. I&#39;m am so disappointed and embarrassed to have been talked down to and to leave The Cheesecake Factory feeling like my time and money has no value. I am saddened to say that I do not plan on visiting what was once one of my favorite establishments any time in the future.

This is always a treat because we don&#39;t have one near us. Unfortunately the table next to us sat down after us and received all their food before us and we had ordered appetizers only. When I received my taquitos they were cold and I had to send them back. The service was great as usual never an empty glass. I realize it is Christmas season and everyone is hustling &amp; bustling but I was a little disappointed.

Our experience was absolutely terrible today. We sat on the patio and it was basically like we were in Timbuktu... Our server had a terrible attitude and went MIA for long periods of time. We asked other servers and the hostess to find our server, but still no server. Someone set the alarm off and it took management a solid 10 minutes to come out and turn it off. Completely disturbing... The manager came out, turned it off. We mentioned how terrible our experience had been. He apologized once and walked away. It was a 3 hour lunch that could have easily been an hour. From the time we finished our food to the time we were offered dessert (after we asked for our server 3 times) was probably 30 minutes. <br><br>To sum it up, terrible service and extremely disappointing management. We will not be returning.

I like this location. I arrived and was seated almost immediately on the patio. My food came out pretty quickly...then again it wasn&#39;t packed in there. I got the chicken n biscuits with no mash and extra vegetables. It was awesome as always! The waiter was very attentive! Food is regularly priced here but can def go up! All I drank was water.

Location is still rather new so it&#39;s very busy and disorganized most of the time. Whether you&#39;re dining in or taking out its always a mix up and something will occur that will affect your order.<br><br>Overall the food is decent, it&#39;s just the service is really frustrating there...

Justin was absolutely the worst manager that you could ask for a night where a big corporate company brings in 25 people to have a nice dinner. He was the most uncooperative person I could ever imagine working with. Refuse to seat us together and refused to seat us in a timely manner. Made multiple comments about sexuality and gender. We will never be visiting this establishment again. By the way our bill was $1500 before tip and alcohol thanks but no thanks.
Awesome service and food was excellent!  Our server Tina was professional and very accommodating. She represented the Cheesecake Factory brand very well. Will definitely visit again.

Came here today due to my craving for chicken Madeira ( craving I had for a month). The wait wasn&#39;t bad due to it being a Saturday, and we got our table maybe 5 min of waiting. We were sat outside. We were at our table around 7:15 and a long wait for our app. They came and it was good. The waitress was kind to apologize about the food being late. Second issues was our main meal. That was a wait past 30 min. When I got my food, I instantly knew that it was wrong. The chicken was drenched in oil. It even tasted like oil on the chicken. The waitress took it back and the manager came. When he came he instantly knew the dish was wrong, ( I mean the chicken was literally sitting in oil). He apologized and ordered me a new one. That took a shorter wait, but when that one came out, it was still chicken sitting in oil. The waitress this time, even knew it wasn&#39;t suppose to look like that and took it back for me. The manager again came out and apologized. I love the Cheesecake Factory but my heart was Dying for that dish! So my rating is based only on my food. The waitress and manager did so well to try and fix the problem. Hopefully the next time I come here ( not for awhile), the chicken Madeira will be on point!

Awful service. The waiter doesn&#39;t even stop to ask if we need anything half of the times. There&#39;s some problem with the customers in the next table, but that shouldn&#39;t make our service that bad. They haven&#39;t cleaned the table for 15 minutes.

Is horrible service, we sitting and waiting for 15 minuets no body come and asked for the order. . Only the girl font table service come to asked no one come here yet. Unbelievable service for the Cheesecake Factory at Lenox mall. We never come back here again

Meh. My family ate here with a friend this weekend and were not impressed. The Greek salad was bland and the best salad was off. How do you mess up salad?! The orange chicken was mediocre. My hubby did like the chicken sliders. Overall, nothing to brag about and nothing to pay $100 for.

This place was packed Saturday night and honestly, I don&#39;t know why. It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory. The Nashville Hot Chicken Nuggets were tasty, but I&#39;m sure they&#39;d be better from an actual hot chicken place in Nashville. Our server wasn&#39;t very attentive and the whole place felt chaotic. The Chipotle Pasta was okay but I was disappointed with the Red Velvet Cheesecake.
I love it . The customer service is awesome to not mention their delicious pasta and carne asada .

Yes, it hit the spot!  Great food &amp; Cheesecakes with massive portions.  <br><br>Highlights:  Amazing Cheesecake plus Food is cooked right and tastes great, Huge menu selection with now great healthy options, Massive portions for the price, Fast service, Short wait, Clean and Ample parking.  <br><br>Can improve:  Take reservations.  <br><br>Benchmark:  They set the standard for Cheesecakes in my book and I have tried all the popular spots in New York City to compare.  Their food is good as well and extremely reasonable for the portions they provide.<br><br>Dined in Aug 2015 and will return.  Def. try the chocolate mousse cheesecake.

The food is good. We ordered different pastas and steak and we enjoyed it. It was delicious. However, the service was bad. They were rude. And don&#39;t cRe about the people. Just they want the money. But i liked the food
The skinnylicious Asian chicken salad was huge but not that tasty!! The service was okay.

50 minutes.  That&#39;s how long it took from order to food delivered to table on a Thursday night.  Got there at 830, waited for a table until 9, ordered at 915, dinner &#34;served&#34; at 1005. Not even an apology for how long that took.  <br><br>No restaurant in the world is worth that sort of wait. We should have just walked.  There&#39;s nothing special about this food--it&#39;s just another chain. With so many great options in Atlanta, I got outvoted because a few people in my party really wanted &#34;great&#34; desserts.  The cheesecakes are frozen, people.  They are made somewhere else and frozen, then (mostly) thawed at the locations. <br><br>I am re-evaluating my &#34;friends&#34; that thought this place was a great idea. Such poor judgement suggest deficiencies elsewhere. If you think this place is great, I don&#39;t think we should travel in the same social circle.

We love love love this place for any night we can&#39;t decide where to eat! I would always resort to this place, but the last time I was there... found a hair in our food and not even an apology was given. Our waiter ignored us till the end and just waited at our table until we tipped her. Hope this never happens again to us or anyone!
I&#39;ve eaten here several times, and it&#39;s a hit or miss each time. Today was a miss. Service was a miss and the food was just ok.  The desserts; however,  was very good.

3 stars is about right.  We were slow to be acknowledged and the food was slow to come out.  Service was ok but not personable nor very polite.  As a business traveler there are too many other options to return unfortunately. <br><br>I do expect more from Cheesecake Factory.
Dirty silverware and dishes. Smart-ass manager, &#34;I&#39;m sorry, we don&#39;t polish our plates.&#34;

Bacon bacon burger was a monster of a burger to devour! I recommend that burger to any of my friends any day. It had different types of bacon on the burger and it gave jt a sweet and smokey taste.  <br>The filet mignon was well worth the price of 30$. <br>I will definitely be coming here again soon.

I walked in and placed to go order. Cashier advised that it will take 15 to 20 min. Well, it took 30 min for the food to be ready and then 45 more min to CHECK ME OUT! Great management! Nothing else to add. Actually there is - the order ended up messed up!  This is not even funny to read, huh?

Going to the Lenox Mall location on a Saturday I knew it was going to be a wait. When I called to the desk for my table what caught me attention was seeing one of the hostess pick up a dirty rag with silverware in the same hand to go wipe down a table. If she and the other hostess did the same thing with all the tables think about the germs that were spreaded since they place the silverware on the bare table tops. It&#39;s been a couple of years since I been to a Cheesecake Factory and I hope what I saw is not a common practice. Men restroom was dirty also.

I don&#39;t even like Cheesecake Factory&#39;s food, but my friends chose it for an end of semester dinner last year. Our party of about nine didn&#39;t make a reservation because we assumed Thursday nights wouldn&#39;t be that busy. I asked the hostess how long the wait would be for nine and she said two hours, which I wasn&#39;t so displeased by considering our large group. Just the thing is, one of my friends didn&#39;t believe me when I relayed what the hostess had said to me so she decided to ask herself. A hostess, not sure if it was the same one, then told her half an hour for a party of nine maybe four minutes after I had already asked...?

I&#39;m VERY DISAPPOINTED with BRAD, one of the  Managers (the other was Alex) on duty at this location. I ordered take out last night and loved my dish! So I ordered it again for the road (Back to Orlando, FL) only to find out that the order was incorrectly made. I called and spoke to Brad who told me there was nothing he could do and hung up the phone on me. I frequent Cheesecake Factory because I love it so much but this was the most disgusting customer service I&#39;ve ever received! Shame on you BRAD and corporate will also hear from me.

We are about to walk out , very poor service. After informing our waiter that our nachos is bad he told us that he will call the manager after 15 minutes he came back with a very cold cup of canned cheese! Nachos was burned and with no cheese . If manager can&#39;t take a minute to address the issues with the food ! How can he manage the restaurant. Been to many cheese cake factories and by far this is the worse one

This location is very very very bad, for starters there is absolutely noooooooo and I mean nooooo customer service! Lets start off from the hostess who when you walk in does not speak, nor acknowledge you when you come through the door. We came for happy hour and after we found our table we sat there for 20 minutes before our server walked up to greet us. Well happy hour ends at 6pm by this time it&#39;s 5:54, we literally had to grab her to tell her to put our order in because we knew about the time cutoff. After getting our food and dropping it off at the table that was it with the service. Let&#39;s just say we were not a priority or care to her. The food was extremely greasy (we asked to swap it that was a no go) the manager who we asked for the swap didn&#39;t give a care either. I will leave the details out for this review on yelp, however with there long extreme wait non caring staff, chefs in the back who clearly don&#39;t care I would not eat at this location! You are better off enjoying other local food around the area.
Food is so so and the service is a hit or miss.  I like the location and the deserts.

Highlights: This is of the new Lenox Mall location... If you care about service, go elsewhere.<br><br>Outside of ordering takeout cheesecakes, I usually go to the Cheesecake Factory with groups of people, mainly because of the varied menu and the ease of accommodation. I&#39;ve never had any problems until now. I planned to visit today with a group of 11 and was thoroughly turned off by the service I received. I called in to inquire about a reservation and was met with a rude hostess on the other end. <br><br>She tartly told me they don&#39;t take reservations and they don&#39;t accommodate large groups well. That was news to me since Cheesecake Factory&#39;s own website, specifically the details section for the Lenox location says &#34;We can easily accomodate large parties.&#34; She also said we&#39;d have to wait two hours. As I was saying, &#34;Ah OK, thanks,&#34; she simply hung up the call. Wow, really? I planned to call the manager, but didn&#39;t want to be put on hold for an obscene amount of time. Instead, I&#39;m calling corporate about the sorry service. <br><br>**Manager&#39;s take note: Service is still a priority for many patrons. If the gatekeepers of your establishment are turning people off/away you have a real problem that needs addressing.
Thai lettuce wraps are awesome.  Bathroom be hella dirty sometimes.  Fast seating even on busy days. Parking is Decent unless it&#39;s a holiday
Great service!!! S/O to the manager Mr.Dennis for the amazing service!! I will def be back again.. Ask for Miller to be your server! He&#39;s official

If you&#39;re looking for hospitality, you SURELY will NOT find it here. From start to finish, the experience was horrible. The people who work here act like they hate their life and everyone in it. I felt like a bother. Will not return. The food just isn&#39;t worth it.

The food was decent, but it took a long time for our waitress to come see us. We never got bread that she kept saying was coming and she never even refilled our waters. I never realized how overwhelming the menu is at Cheesecake Factory as well.

I DESPISE this location!!! My to go order is ALWAYS wrong!! I live down the street from this location but go out of my way to perimeter where my order is always correct and the staff have better attitudes! I&#39;ve even written in and complained about the Lenox location. Nothing changes. My salads always have discolored avocados!! Why??? Only here. So annoying!!

I&#39;m not sure why this place only has 3 stars on the overall rating? I had a good experience here when I came for lunch. I was seated promptly, and the waitress- Kayla was super cool and very pretty. She had a great attitude and was very accommodating throughout the dining experience. The food was fresh, and the place was nice and clean (including the restroom). This was my first time at THIS location. I&#39;d definitely recommend giving this place a try!!

Seriously??!! It wasn&#39;t that busy when we went in. All we were getting were desserts to go. We had to wait minutes for the slice of Pineapple Upside Down Cheese cake and slice of Blackout Cake we ordered. I checked the order and the sliver of cheesecake was about the same size as the to-go fork they gave us. There was a line by this time so I didn&#39;t bother to say anything to them and would just have to deal with it (such a scam). What the heck is with this bait and switch Cheesecake Factory pulls with to-go desserts??!! Come on! When one is paying nearly $8 for a slice of cake it better be worth $8 bucks, especially when I know I could get an ENTIRE cheesecake for $8 else where, yeah it&#39;s called Publix bakery. Get it together, geez, so annoying.

I am so disappointed with my visit here. I ordered Chicken Bellagio and it  came with at least 1/4 cup of basil oil. My pasta and chicken was swimming in the oil. It&#39;s so oily that I had to use a spoon and take out as much oil as possible. I ended up with a full bread plate of oil and there was still more in the dish. The server saw it and didn&#39;t say anything. I asked for the manager and she same and saw my plate. She only agreed that it&#39;s a lot of oil but did not apologize. She then took my plate and left and never came back. It is unacceptable. This kind of service should not be coming from the cheesecake factory. I will not return and do not recommend this location based on their service and the food.

Really poor service. Very busy place. I was waiting for 40 minutes and they didn&#39;t get my food. I requested to see a manager and they completely ignored/ forgot about it. Food was average (I used to live the food here but was at a Cheesecake Factory in a while), not worth the trouble.

Busy busy busy that is this chain resturant if you can&#39;t find anything you want on this menu something is wrong!<br><br>Cobb salad was good and big.  The cashew chicken slightly dry but enjoyable.  Food get a 3<br><br>Cheesecake gets a 5.  <br><br>Service was good.   Split the difference for ac4

One of my favorite place to dine. First time at this location. Had to wait 45 min for a table for 2 at 3pm on Sunday. Excellent service and food was very good.  Steak Diane had more spices then I care for. It had a kick to it.  Giving a 4 stars because they ran out of the cheesecake that I wanted.

Not fond of this location. Food was mediocre and our service SUCKED so bad that it made the food seem outstanding. It was Super Bowl Sunday, but SO WHAT!! It was also my birthday dinner choice. My night was not nearly as fun as hoped to be because of this experience by a girl who had NO clue how to be a server. <br>1) IF other&#39;s must run out all your food, at least check by to make sure it&#39;s satisfactory! (also, remind your food runner to NOT hand your patron her salad OVER THE HEAD of the person next to her in mid air!) unbelievable!<br>2) drink refills are a good thing! (had to request it twice, while you plainly could see the empty glass) <br>3) do not ever, ever come to a table to refill drinks, etc. while holding a towel that you JUST USED TO CLEAN THE SEATING next to them!! OMG!<br>4) Change professions....quick! <br><br>I wasn&#39;t paying the check so I am positive she was OVER tipped by my sweet friends. VERY disappointed.

Absolutely delicious. My husband declared his burger today the best he has ever had anywhere. My southwestern salad with 1000island was predictably yummy. Service was perfect. On a good day this place is had to beat for value and service.  Oh and the burger was a perfect med. rare. No wait at 11:45am on a Thursday.

THIS The Cheesecake Factory location has an exemplary staff from the manager Brad, the host staff and, server (Pierre)!  Brad enhanced our visit with personal service to our party of 12 on a very busy Sunday. He was kind, patient and, helpful.<br><br>My &#34;Well-mannered Martini&#34;, our delicious entrees (Mac &amp; cheeseburger for one), salads and, ample cheesecake desserts DID NOT disappoint. <br><br>TCF ambiance is always enjoyed and is a factor in choosing this restaurant for a special occasion (a christening luncheon), but going to TCF IS an occasion regardless of the motivation!<br><br>I recommend this TCF location particularly if Brad is in charge! I dare you to be disappointed! If you are, I will pay for your cheesecake!
Simply the best of Service!  Bravo to Jonathan our server.  He was very attentive and professional.  Great management team--Nicole and Michael are the epitome of hospitality and professionalism.

Our lunch here was delightful today. We had Jonathan G. as our server and he took great care of the group of ladies we had today for a work lunch. The operations manager, Nicole Davis is always helpful when planning an event or group coming to eat. Thank you for the hospitality and great food.

Our meal was good, but ironically, my cheesecake was the most disappointing part of our experience. <br><br>I&#39;ve had Cheesecake Factory&#39;s hot fudge before and was looking forward to it as a topping for my vanilla bean cheesecake. But instead I got a small cup of a thin chocolate sauce that was clearly not hot fudge. I asked the waitress about it, and she said, &#34;We have two, the pump and the squeeze bottle. Sometimes the pump acts up and they use the squeeze bottle.&#34; She went back to check on getting actual hot fudge, but returned and repeated, &#34;Yeah, the pump is acting up.&#34;<br><br>Seems like they could simply take off the pump and scoop out the hot fudge, but either way, substituting what was clearly Hershey&#39;s syrup is not a solution. I would have rather she&#39;d told me they didn&#39;t have hot fudge so I could order a different flavor cheesecake.<br><br>As you can see, I have very strong opinions where hot fudge is concerned, and this Cheesecake Factory location clearly does not have the same respect.

I always like a good meal from TCF but my visit for daughter&#39;s birthday was ehh.  We had initially stated that we were having 7 for dinner but 2 guests were a no show.  Once we received the message that our table was ready (2hrs later) my daughter and friend was in the mall since while we had a long wait and we were told they needed all 7 guests or they could not seat us (okay) and they had 5 mins or our table would be gone (wait what?).  Called and told her to hurry (the birthday girl is running).  When the kids arrived I could her the host say make sure they have seven guests or we can&#39;t seat them.  We had 5 how about that.<br>Once seated-had to move my car since I had to park on the opposite end of the mall and the mall was closing.  While I was gone my sister told me a loud disturbance/fight had ensued while I was gone (huh, wait, what?).<br> Received our food it was blah, not good.  This location was below TCF standards; hosting service and food.  I ain&#39;t going back never ever.<br><br>Our waiter was 5 star *****
Cheesecake Factory is Cheesecake Factory. Never disappointed. Always satisfied. They have great drinks and even better desserts

We sat outside very nice, quiet &amp; kind of romantic place with dimmed lights, loved it. The food was AMAZING. I got extremely full which never happens because most places make pastas in small portions. I also got a cheesecake, it was delicious. DEFINITELY coming back.

As you see, a great majority of the positive comments about this location are from last year.  I love The Cheesecake Factory, but to echo the many people here, the staff at this location predominantly is HORRIBLE.  Experienced a rude lady on staff last November who works the dessert and pickup area.  I hope she sees this too because she&#39;ll know it&#39;s her based on the time of year.  RUDE MANAGERS who ALL NEED TO BE FIRED.  Have spoken to the managers and not only were they no help with the issues, they flat out didn&#39;t care.  As you also see here, nobody from the restaurant has dropped by to respond to these reviews or take them into consideration.  THEY DON&#39;T CARE.  They take for granted that people will just flock there because of the food, so they don&#39;t care how they treat people.  The General Manager told my sister on the phone when she called that &#34;you could imagine how many customers we had last night&#34;... Um, every customer should feel like the only customer!<br><br>I ordered delivery from them (ADDED 4/27...thru DoorDash-- because they also swore up and down that they don&#39;t do delivery lol smh) and items were missing-- the managers, including the General Manager, were NO HELP WHATSOEVER and did not replace the items.  The missing items were caramel sauce ON the cheesecake (they are also not fixing cheesecakes right either because the Dutch Caramel Apple Pie is to come with caramel sauce on the cheesecake), the second dollop of whipped cream (that a manager told us only one dollop comes with cheesecakes-- dead wrong), and complimentary bread for one of the meals.  They sent us two Dutch Caramel cheesecakes ONLY and gave us a hard time about sending the free bread that people eat baskets of! Get this, there was only one of those Dutch Caramels ordered and a Dulce cheesecake ordered originally, but they sent us two Dutch Caramels; we didn&#39;t even request that cheesecake be sent, so some smart person gave $20 away.  If service was like this at their previous location on Peachtree, I&#39;m not surprised people zoomed right by without stopping!  The ambiance of the Lenox Mall location is way too nice for these nasty people-- they need to be replaced and should find jobs away from people.

Amazing! Great food, great service, great atmosphere! Huge menu, several pages. Drinks are mostly sweet but they have a large selection. My favorite is the J.W pink lemonade! The bread is great wheat and white. ;) <br><br>go early and add name to reservation list, they send you a text when table is ready, so you have time to browse mall.<br><br>Average 32 a person with a drink! Great for data night! Seat outside. <br><br>-AV

I came here for lunch with a friend and was highly disappointed. <br><br>I ordered the lunch salmon special and it was very bland. My friend ordered a soup, salad, and sandwich combo and the bread was as hard as a rock (literally), the soup looked like pancake batter, and her salad was very sloppy.  <br><br>Since I never complain I barely ate my food but paid for my meal anyway with no complaints. My friend advised our server that she didn&#39;t like her meal and ordered something else that was also badly plated and poorly seasoned.<br><br>The worst of it all was really the service.  I think our servers name was Jaylene.  Apparently, during our dining experience, Jaylene was getting off and the next shift was starting so she asked us 6 times (we counted) if we wanted dessert.  Once before I even ordered my meal (my friend arrived before I did).  My friend eventually asked her if she was getting off and offered to pay our tab.  It&#39;s in bad taste to be rushed out of the door at 3pm in the afternoon. Did I mention that the seats were dirty?  <br><br>Maybe it was an off day.

Oh, I used to love this place when they first opened across the US. I would travel to the different locations just to eat their food. Now I feel they are over rated and the food quality, flavor and presentation has gone down. The food I had today shrimp scampi was not flavorful at all. Along with the crab dip it was just okay. I am giving it two stars. It is not one of my favorite places anymore. I probably won&#39;t be back for a long time.

Any Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorites! I just live their food! I been here countless times one of them being on my birthday, I had the option to go to Florida or Atlanta and I chose Cumberland just to go eat here AGAIN! I just love how I matter how many people are waiting we get a table FAST! And the food is just delicious!

Visited this location this past weekend and put our names on the list. We were told it would be 40-45 minutes before we would be seated. We went to a store in the mall to kill time and was surprised to receive the text within 30 minutes that our table was ready. I ordered the butter lettuce wrap Mexican tacos and they were delicious and filling. Great choice for anyone looking to cut back on carbs.

We went for brunch and the service was great. I had the Farmhouse Omelette which was delicious and my friend had the breakfast burrito which he really enjoyed. The portions on both were quite large, so even though the price may have been a bit more than other brunch spots we considered, I think it was well worth it.

Only because I was in such a mood for cheesecake that I braved the rainy weather did I TOLERATE the outright filth of this establishment. Not what you&#39;d expect hanging out at Lennox and all. The smell hits you as soon as you step in the door. Like all the tables had been wiped down with a dirty rag and the bar taps have never once been steam cleaned. You seriously got to hold your breath and get really tipsy to get comfortable. One word, unsanitary.

I love the new location.  It&#39;s much more convenient to access.  They also have curbside takeaway!  They have designated six parking spaces where you can have your food delivered to you after you phone in your order.  The booths are more intimate than all of the seating in the middle.  <br><br>The manager mentioned that the new restaurant is literally half the size of the previous one (from 500 down to 250) but they have literally doubled the number of people coming in there each day!  <br><br>On my recent visit the food was consistent as usual.  The tex mex rolls are always great...the sliders and chicken sliders have always been one of my favorites. Their menu is a small novel, so you will always find something....no matter what your mood is.  <br><br>The biggest downside on my recent visit was the service.  The service is hot and cold here.  This time the server was nowhere to be found for most of the meal.  I kept having to flag down other servers....<br><br>The other complaint most people have is that in this day and age, it&#39;s hard to go somewhere that doesn&#39;t take reservations.  It&#39;s so easy to make online reservations at most Atlanta restaurants and not have to wait ...sometimes it&#39;s hard to justify going anywhere won&#39;t accept reservations.  I always recommend calling and finding out how bad the wait is before going to Cheesecake Factory.  I would also recommend staying away on a Saturday  night.  There are hundreds and hundreds of top Atlanta restaurants that are on Opentable and accept online reservations.  Why bother going somewhere on a Sat. night where you might have to wait an hour to be seated??

We went to Cheescake factory last night. There was a wait of around 15 mins. That is normal since it was a Thursday evening and also a day before good friday. The server was friendly in the beginning and later while taking order for entrees/appetizers, he was taking dishes from the adjacent table and talking to us. He , from that point of time, did not seem to be interested in serving us. Anyways I ordered Crab and Artichoke dip with bread. It was yum. I loved that. Strawberry lemonade was just too good. The bartender knew how to mix in right proportions. <br><br>My wife ordered Margerita pizza and it took long time to come. The waiter did not even bother to ask whether do we need anything else or are we still waiting for something to come. I had to signal him to come to my table and ask why pizza is taking long time. After that it took several minutes for them to bring. The quality of the pizza suffered and it did not look what we saw in the picture. <br><br>I am a fan of the food what I ordered, however I am disappointed with the service. <br><br>Kindly improve it. I hope when I visit next time, I am forced to write a good review.

I was given a 4 hr wait time on a saturday night. No biggie. You expect these things. Popular restaurant, popular side of town. Done deal. However, this was my bday dinner, which had already been ruined by another restaurant. SO I was on edge. We were given the wait time and I asked if they thought we could possibly get in sooner. I was told that it was basically possible. So we waited. My friends grew hungry so we went back in to evaluate. We were sure that not everyone would want to wait so we took our chances. However, when we came back in and asked we received the following response. &#34;We quoted you 4 hrs. You only waited 1 hour and 16 minutes. You&#39;re GONNA have to wait the full 4 hr.* *neckroll, neck jut and head cock...with attitude* No No boo boo. I can deal with a wait, but what I WON&#34;T deal with is rudeness. We high tailed it out of there so fast. Before I was on Channel 2 for  choking someone on my birthday. I would never, but I was irked enough to. Do better.

We had a party of 25 for dinner at the cheesecake factory on Tuesday. The staff did a good job but the restaurant was out of a number of food items that we tried to order. But the worst part of the experience was the fact that the manager Justin was rude and refused to bring an extra table over for a party, which had three people without a table. The Worst management of a nice restaurant I have ever experienced.

Me and Adam were looking for a spot with outdoor seating today. He suggested coming here and it turned out to be a great idea.
